Title: Senior Data Scientist - Marketing Science
Description:
Smartly has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Marketing Science focussed Data Scientist to join our growing Performance team in EMEA.

We are looking for a customer-facing data scientist who enjoys analyzing sophisticated systems and can communicate findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. Your role is crucial in making sure we can systematically improve optimization across our customers!

You will work with our distributed team of customer-facing data scientists based in our offices in Helsinki, New York, and San Francisco. In this role you will analyze, validate, and test standard methodologies in paid social advertising. You will be working closely together with both product development and commercial colleagues.

As a Marketing Science Data Scientist you will...


Perform quantitative research to support sales and marketing proof points
Drive thought leadership in the areas of optimization, testing, attribution and market insights within the Smartly organization and across the customer base
Perform performance meta analyses, vertical research, and playbooks based on scientifically sound analytics
Serve as the day-to-day trusted measurement consultant for key strategic advertisers by analyzing customers’ performance marketing data and develop methods to determine what works and, more meaningfully, why it works
Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products



What We Are Looking For...


5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)



Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.


Show more
HTML:
Smartly has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Marketing Science focussed Data Scientist to join our growing Performance team in EMEA.

We are looking for a customer-facing data scientist who enjoys analyzing sophisticated systems and can communicate findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. Your role is crucial in making sure we can systematically improve optimization across our customers!

You will work with our distributed team of customer-facing data scientists based in our offices in Helsinki, New York, and San Francisco. In this role you will analyze, validate, and test standard methodologies in paid social advertising. You will be working closely together with both product development and commercial colleagues.

As a Marketing Science Data Scientist you will...

  • Perform quantitative research to support sales and marketing proof points
  • Drive thought leadership in the areas of optimization, testing, attribution and market insights within the Smartly organization and across the customer base
  • Perform performance meta analyses, vertical research, and playbooks based on scientifically sound analytics
  • Serve as the day-to-day trusted measurement consultant for key strategic advertisers by analyzing customers’ performance marketing data and develop methods to determine what works and, more meaningfully, why it works
  • Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
  • Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products


What We Are Looking For...

  • 5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
  • Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
  • Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
  • Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
  • Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)


Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Ad Tech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world’s leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for Staff Data Scientists (all genders) to join the Ad Tech data science team in our mission to deliver consistently amazing experiences.

You will be a thought leader, driving innovation by designing and deploying our models to the forefront of technology to solve complex problems, delivering revenue for Delivery Hero at the frontline of our growth & profitability journey.

At Delivery Hero, AdTech introduces people to new food they love and enables our partners to meet their future customers at the perfect moment. We have developed a range of products to offer advertising solutions for restaurants helping them to increase their visibility and reach, improve their order conversion, and eventually drive more sales by covering the entire marketing funnel. Operating across over 50 countries around the clock, our Ad Tech connects the ideal advertiser with the ideal customer millions of times every day. In 2024/25, Ad Tech is a fundamental area for us on our path to profitability and is predicted to generate more than 1 billion euros in revenue for Delivery Hero; our data science team is at the heart of this growth, powering personalisation, relevance, and recommendation.

The Ad Tech data science team operates within the wider Vendor Data tribe whose mission is to drive innovation, insight-driven decision making and to solve business problems through a culture of excellence and openness. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions covering a host of business opportunities across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Spearhead a revolution of Ad Tech at Delivery Hero through the innovative application of cutting edge tools and techniques such as neural networks and reinforcement learning covering areas such as ad ranking, bidding strategies, and ad pacing driving unparalleled improvements in advertising campaigns.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve ad relevance, click-through rates, and conversion metrics.
Lead research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in AdTech and machine learning, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's advertising products and algorithms. Remain at the forefront of industry and research developments incorporating new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows and models.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science and machine learning, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data science team.


What you need to be successful


You are an industry-leading talent at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver enormous value to the business.
You raise the performance of other team members through effective and mature mentorship and constructive collaboration to benefit others from your deep understanding and experience of data science.
You have extensive expertise in building and training complex neural network models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit centering around deep learning i.e. Keras and ideally Tensorflow and TFX
Through the seamless use of SQL queries you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and are able to effectively set up your environment to minimise testing loops influencing the entire team to work more efficiently and reliably.
You are familiar with deploying and developing complex neural networks to serve live traffic and experience collaborating with ML engineers in cloud systems, ideally GCP.
You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from a variety of teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Implementing neural networks to specifically solve Ad Tech challenges would be highly desirable.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting user and market behaviour under different circumstances, such as incentives, competitors' activity, and seasonality. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns distribution and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on uplift modelling topics to help shaping the most efficient campaign offerings.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results and communicating to stakeholders
Working closely with the Experimentation team to figure out robust design of campaigns experiments
Studying historical user behaviour data to identify opportunities for optimisation
Building models for optimal users’ discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in feature teams



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended)
Practical experience setting A/B tests and interpreting results
Deep understanding the theory behind statistical hypothesis testing
Profound knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Track record of deploying models to production and measuring the impact
Strong product thinking, ability to communicate and persuade, problem-solving
Experience writing complex SQL queries
Ability to map business and product problems on data science framework
Proactive mindset, willingness to take initiative and work with little supervision
Team player with excellent communication skills
You will get extra credits for experience in modelling and successful implementation of causal inference
You will get extra credits for Ph.D. in Computer Science, statistics, or related quantitative fields, or a Master's degree with equivalent industry experience
You will get extra credits for a background in econometrics, operations research, simulation or quantitative analysis of behaviour



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
Show more

Title: Senior IoT Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a dynamic Green Tech IoT company based in the heart of Berlin, seeking a talented and passionate Senior/Lead Data Scientist to join their team. They are developing innovative solutions to address pressing environmental challenges through the power of Wildfire Detection.




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in unlocking the potential of our data, driving product innovation, and shaping our company's growth.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement robust data pipelines to efficiently process and transform large volumes of sensor data.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform product development and business strategy.
Build predictive models to optimise system performance, enhance user experience, and drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to drive innovation.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proficient in Python.
Strong experience with machine learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn.
Strong experience with modelling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.
Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques: PCA, T-SNE, k-means clustering.
Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




What they offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package plus stock
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with a high impact
Collaborative and inspiring work environment
Flexible work arrangements
Continuous learning and development opportunities




If you are a data scientist with a passion for sustainability and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply! Join us in building a greener future.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Picsart is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst. The Senior Data Analyst role will lead strategic business decisions by developing and providing data analysis and reporting of complex patterns, insights and trends to internal stakeholders. These insights will help solve highly complex business problems, implement best practices and optimise business performance.

By joining us, you will benefit from


An honest, open culture that emphasises feedback and promotes professional and personal development.
Hybrid setup— our team is distributed worldwide, from Armenia to US, UK, Germany, Spain and Romania
Wellbeing benefits (including a monthly wellbeing fund)
Growing opportunities — based on your preference you can grow in the company as a people manager or as an individual contributor.
An environment that fosters innovation and creativity, a culture with the ability to pilot new trends


You will


Work with huge datasets - get, clean and analyze them, use advanced and predictive analytics to create reports and intuitive dashboards
Partner with Business and IT teams to understand data/reporting needs, offer solutions to address specific data/reporting challenges
Execute on business/technical requirements and build multi-purpose interactive dashboard solutions, based on gathered requirements
Visualize and make effective presentations to communicate complex findings in a structured way for non-technical audience
Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize user conversion and retention
Dig deeper into data and find reasons for trends, and metrics changes
Integrate new tools to solve problems more effectively when needed
Define the underlying architecture of data collection and ensure data consistency and accuracy during the transformation process.


About You


BS/MA degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field
3-5 years experience in an analytics or data science position working with large data sets from enterprise database platforms, business intelligence development tools to solve complex business problems
Excellent knowledge of data manipulation languages such as SQL, Python (Pandas, visualization and statistical libraries, etc.)
Strong experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions and explains the whys, utilizing tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manage data collection process, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail
Strong synthesis skills with the ability to analyze huge amount of data and extract insights that will drive the product
Excellent communication and knowledge sharing skills to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated, quick learner and innovative person
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
Detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced written and verbal English communication skills.


What we seek and value most in our candidates

Professionalism in both soft and hard skills; motivation to grow, learn and share, positive attitude, flexibility, transparency, ownership and the most important - passion and commitment.

Picsart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Picsart, Inc. is an E-Verify Employer in the US. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in English or Spanish. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for English or Spanish.

For Applicants Based in California - California Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://rb.gy/lqu5mv)

About Us

Picsart is the world’s largest digital creation platform and a top 20 most downloaded app. Every month, the Picsart community creates, remixes, and shares billions of visual stories using the company’s powerful and easy-to-use editing tools. Picsart has amassed one of the largest open-source content collections in the world, including free-to-edit photos, stickers, backgrounds, templates, and more. Picsart is available in 30 languages for free and as a subscription on iOS, Android, Windows devices and on the Web. Headquartered in Miami, with offices around the world, Picsart is backed by SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, DCM Ventures, Insight Partners, and others. Download the app or visit picsart.com for more information.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
  • Detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Advanced written and verbal English communication skills.

What we seek and value most in our candidates

Professionalism in both soft and hard skills; motivation to grow, learn and share, positive attitude, flexibility, transparency, ownership and the most important - passion and commitment.

Picsart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Picsart, Inc. is an E-Verify Employer in the US. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in English or Spanish. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for English or Spanish.

For Applicants Based in California - California Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://rb.gy/lqu5mv)

About Us

Picsart is the world’s largest digital creation platform and a top 20 most downloaded app. Every month, the Picsart community creates, remixes, and shares billions of visual stories using the company’s powerful and easy-to-use editing tools. Picsart has amassed one of the largest open-source content collections in the world, including free-to-edit photos, stickers, backgrounds, templates, and more. Picsart is available in 30 languages for free and as a subscription on iOS, Android, Windows devices and on the Web. Headquartered in Miami, with offices around the world, Picsart is backed by SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, DCM Ventures, Insight Partners, and others. Download the app or visit picsart.com for more information.

Title: Robotics Engineer - AI
Description:
sensmore is a pioneering AI software automation company, focused on developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for heavy machinery in extreme conditions.

We specialize in AI-powered technologies that enhance understanding and operational intelligence in harsh environments, enabling advanced driver assistance and autonomous functions for industries like mining, construction, and agriculture.

Join us and play a pivotal role in transforming the automation landscape in heavy industries.

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled Robotics Engineer with expertise in AI to enhance our team. This role requires a strong background in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotics. The successful candidate will be instrumental in developing and refining AI-driven robotics systems that improve navigation and perception under challenging conditions.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement AI algorithms for robotic systems to improve perception and navigation capabilities.
Optimize and refine AI systems that leverage radar and other sensory technologies.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate these AI systems into larger robotic solutions.
Manage the full cycle of software development, from initial design through to implementation and ongoing maintenance.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in Python or C++.
Solid understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and robotics.
Practical experience with robotic perception and image processing.
Experience with frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.


Preferred Skills:


Practical experience with 3D vision in robotic applications.
Familiarity with multimodal machine learning models.
Knowledge of outdoor SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) techniques.
Experience with radar data or similar sensory inputs.
Proven track record of publications or significant industry experience in deep learning and AI.


What We Offer:


A dynamic startup environment where you can make a substantial impact.
Competitive salary with equity options.
Flexible hours and hybrid working arrangements to balance personal and professional life.
A diverse, innovative team committed to technological excellence and groundbreaking solutions.
Extensive opportunities for professional development in a fast-growing technology company.


Benefits:


Attractive compensation package and stock options.
Beverages on-site and regular social events.
Engage with top-tier researchers, engineers, and thought leaders.
Influence the future of robotic technologies and tackle significant technological challenges.
Assistance with relocation to Berlin.
Flexible schedules emphasizing quality and productivity.


About Us:

sensmore is comprised of a diverse group of individuals whose varied backgrounds and perspectives fuel our innovation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Although we support remote work, our culture thrives on in-person interactions, which we find essential for tackling the complex problems we face. Our policy requires team members to work onsite at least 50% of the time.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Enterprise Solutions Unit)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.

This is our role as a Data Scientist for those who like to design, develop, test and maintain multiple machine learning-based automated repeatable SEO analysis (‘SEO Workflows’), and perform targeted data analysis assignments for external clients along with the SEO Consulting team.

Tasks in the role

Designing SEO Workflow prototype


Collect workflow requirements from internal and external SEO experts.
Develop a simplified solution prototype.
Test the concept with SEO experts.



Defining the requirements for the workflows


Define success criteria for workflow performance.
Define API contracts to collect the data from Semrush Data Warehouse.
Develop the workflow output.



Developing the workflows


Develop the scripts to perform stable, repeatable, and scalable data analysis.
Develop request scripts to support and enable the main workflow script.



Developing workflow tests


Develop various tests and perform them in testing and production environments, including integration unit, regression, performance and other types of testing.



Custom analysis assignments for external clients


In close collaboration with the SEO Consulting team, develop custom SEO workflows for external clients to perform specific analysis to meet client needs.



Requirements

Who we are looking for


Bachelor's or higher degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong fundamentals in Machine Learning and experience with bringing models into production.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications, including an understanding of their architecture and practical use cases.
Strong programming skills, including proficiency in languages like Python and DS libraries such as pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, transformers, streamlit.
Knowledge of API integration and data collection from various sources.
Experience in conducting comprehensive testing to ensure the reliability and performance of workflows.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external clients.



They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if


Knowledge of SEO best practices and industry trends is a plus.
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better.



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Torch team is responsible for building ML-based automated workflows within the Semrush Enterprise Platform.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


Work format Choice: It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

We’ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients’ real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

Our Data Science team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong expertise in discovering and understanding customer needs, making data-driven decisions within an ambiguous problem space, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on data products.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron’s international team is scaling Flatiron’s approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer providers, and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists are embedded on those teams and their work touches every aspect of Flatiron’s international product and strategy.

Specifically, you’ll:



Rapidly iterate on early stage products where a hybrid skill set of product intuition, customer empathy, and data expertise is essential.
Develop a deep understanding of source data and develop data processing and quality assurance approaches for both structured and unstructured data.
Help shape our approach to integrating machine learning, natural language processing and other automated technologies into Flatiron’s data processing design.
Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders to develop and implement shared data processing strategies and analytic methods to enable real-world evidence generation based on global datasets.
Devise and build data analyses and visualizations that provide value to Flatiron’s data partners and customers.
Immerse yourself in business and technical context to help your team identify opportunities for optimizing our processes and unlocking new value from our unique datasets.
Help mentor and grow other data scientists.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have 4+ years of industry experience in relevant roles.
You’re impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You have a strong background in statistics or analytics and can fit the appropriate analysis approach to complex business or research problems.
You have a track record of applying Machine Learning models to solve product problems and drive business impact.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can explain technical concepts to business and clinical partners.
You are versatile and can easily pick up new programming languages and tools, but come with strong experience in Python.
You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
You are proficient in English.



Extra credit



You have experience working with healthcare-related data.
You have experience productionizing ML models and integrating them with data processing pipelines.
You have experience in Data Engineering, including ETL and data warehousing tools.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.
Show more

Title: ML Inference Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an experienced and passionate ML Inference Engineer to join our team at JetBrains AI. In this role, you’ll play a crucial part in deploying and optimizing ML models, ensuring they run efficiently and effectively in production environments.




We value engineers who:

Work well both independently and as part of a collaborative team environment.
Communicate effectively, both in writing and verbally, with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Take ownership of projects and drive them to completion with a high degree of quality.




In this role, you will:

Optimize and run ML models for inference in high-load production environments.
Collaborate with ML engineers to develop scalable and efficient pipelines.
Monitor and troubleshoot ML models in production, ensuring their reliability and performance.
Contribute to the development of best practices for ML deployment and inference.




We’ll be happy to have you on our team if you have:

Proven experience in deploying ML models to production, including experience with model optimization techniques (e.g., quantization, knowledge distillation).
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with other programming languages (e.g., C++, Java).
Proficiency with ML frameworks such as PyTorch and common libraries for NLP.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for ML deployment.
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.




We’d be especially thrilled if you have:

Advanced knowledge of model serving frameworks such as vLLM, TensorRT-LLM, Llama.cpp, OpenVINO, or similar.
Experience with profiling ML and MLOps code to identify bottlenecks and achieve better performance.
Experience with MLOps tools and practices, including CI/CD for ML.
Expertise in optimizing models for latency and throughput in production environments.
Previous work experience with NLP and LLMs.




To develop JetBrains AI, we use:

Git for source control management.
AWS and GCP for cloud computing infrastructure.
Python, PyTorch, and Hugging Face as our ML development stack.
TeamCity as a CI automation system.




We process the data provided in your job application in accordance with the Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://www.jetbrains.com/legal/privacy/privacy-recruitment.html)

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, using artificial intelligence to optimise energy production, integration, and efficiency. We're looking for a passionate Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of sustainable energy.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with domain experts to identify renewable energy challenges where machine learning can provide solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models for tasks such as:
Solar energy forecasting
Wind turbine performance optimization
Demand response management for the power grid
Predictive maintenance for renewable energy infrastructure
Oversee the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and pre-processing to model deployment and monitoring.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in machine learning for renewable energy applications.
Mentor and guide junior engineers on the team and lead recruitment of new team members.




Qualifications:

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and their applications (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning).
Proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Experience working with big data and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
A passion for renewable energy and sustainability.




Benefits:

Be part of a mission-driven company that's making a real difference in the world.
Work on challenging and impactful projects with real-world applications.
Collaborate with a talented team of engineers and scientists.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.

Title: AI Engineer - Freelance
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer

Client: Financial Services

Location: Berlin (remote)

Duration: 12 months initially

Language: German/English




Main purpose of the role:

• Expand AI innovation and delivery capacities for that business

• Develop data science and data engineering prototypes

• General continuous integration and development

• Create, craft, and bring to life generative AI-driven solutions

• Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to gather, refine, and prepare data

• Enhance the precision, efficiency, and scalability of generative

• AI offerings Implement generative AI models for operational use

• Assess the effectiveness of generative AI solutions and establish pathways for ongoing enhancement




Who am I looking for:

Practical Experience:

Possess 3 years of hands-on expertise in AI and ML, with an inaugural foray into Generative AI, preferably within leading tech firms and start-up environments.

AI Proficiency: Demonstrate adeptness with the Generative AI technology stack for tackling practical challenges, such as:

Executing end-to-end Machine Learning projects

Utilizing prevalent models (both proprietary and open source)

Implementing data pipelines (e.g., Databricks)

Operating with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone)

Leveraging orchestrators (e.g., LangChain)

Utilizing cloud services (e.g., Azure)




FINANCIAL SERVICES / CORPORATE EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Selection Analytics
Description:
Job Description

About the Team

The Selection Analytics Team at Wolt owns the data and infrastructure that helps all 27 of our markets build a portfolio of high-quality restaurant and retail merchants. Our overarching mission is to provide the best selection to customers by enabling sales teams across all markets to acquire the best merchants.

To do this, we work directly with country sales teams to help them identify and prioritize the highest potential merchant candidates. We also work with Wolt leadership by providing metrics to track selection quality, upon which they develop strategic initiatives and goals. This is a lean and mighty team that owns and operates the engine for merchant acquisition globally.

About The Role

As a senior member of the Selection Analytics team, your role involves leveling up our approach to identifying and prioritizing better merchants. You’ll achieve this by a) developing metrics to unlock deeper insights into merchant selection quality for all markets b) developing and running experiments to understand the impact of selection on specific markets c) develop self-serve tooling to track these insights

This is also a rare, high-exposure experience where you will then use your findings to work directly with country leadership to help them uncover growth opportunities. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just crunching numbers and creating dashboards.

The team is looking for a versatile analytics expert who knows how to move fast, work cross-functionally, and deliver business results. If you are excited to build from 0 to 1, interested in global exposure, and have experience using deep analytics to solve hard problems - we're looking for someone like you.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these cities - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.

Our humble expectations


3-5 years of experience in data science, consulting, or related quantitative role
Strong exploratory data analysis skills, willingness to look under the hood.
Deep understanding of the data science workflow, including experimental design and key statistical methods, with strong communication skills for complex topics.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages (R, Python, etc.) and SQL.
Proficiency in one or more analytics & visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
Determination to initiate and lead/own strategic projects to completion in a scrappy environment with a cross-functional team
Innate curiosity to understand how things work and a first-principles approach to problem solving


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Lead - Marta Palac (marta.palac@wolt.com).

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Kertos Intro

⚠️ Given the nature of this research project's funding, you have to be a resident of Berlin, Germany and open to spending 2-3 days in the office on site there. If this is not your case, please don’t apply, as it is a hard requirement. Please also note that we cannot offer assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship at the moment.

Your purpose at Kertos

You’re part of our newest Product Squad in Berlin which will focus on our latest research project to push the automation capabilities of the Kertos Platform even further. As Machine Learning Engineer here at Kertos, you’ll own the machine learning aspect of this project, where we continuously integrate cutting-edge models and frameworks to bring various LLM-based features to life. From conceptualising models, knowledge graphs to bringing the models to live and ensuring its functionality across the whole lifecycle of our models – you’ll have a huge impact on the future of our company and revolutionise the information security and data privacy landscape with us!

What You’ll Be Doing Here


Contribute in product development: bring in your ideas and automate workflows, improve suggestions and increase user satisfaction even further
Develop technical concepts and approaches across the whole development lifecycle
Collaborate with your team members to achieve internal automation as well as a seamless integration into our existing tech stack
Integrate MLOps principles and tools that help you and your team for development
Make sure the developed models work as expected in our production environments in a secure and stable way
Be creative in acquiring new data automatically to enhance our models and systems
Build the foundation of various AI-driven use cases for the Kertos platform


The skills, motivation, and mentality you should bring


You are an expert when it comes to Python and Machine Learning with multiple years of professional experience
You have hands-on knowledge about MLOps and bringing models to production
If you also have experience with knowledge graphs and/or NLP & embeddings, this would be a big plus
You constantly challenge our status quo, love to spark innovation and strive to grow with us, as a team
You are a strong communicator and have excellent collaboration abilities to effectively work in cross-functional, agile teams


Why Kertos


Number one: You get to build our Machine Learning toolchain and software from the ground up, using the newest technologies
Best of both worlds: As this is a research project, you will get both the benefits of research and cutting edge technology as well as startup culture in our Berlin Office
You are Kertos: Don’t like something? Could be done better? You have the freedom to push things forward and contribute to making Kertos a great place to work
Unique opportunity: Join the growing team of one of Europe’s most promising early stages companies and to work directly with our CTO and co-founder Alex
Regular Feedback: We foster an open feedback culture and support your growth with regular 1-on-1 meetings
Keep growing: To boost your professional and personal growth, we provide you with a Personal Development Budget of 1.500€ per year
Mental Health: We've partnered with Likeminded to prioritize your well-being, offering personalized mental health support for all employees
Cutting Edge Technology: Leading VCs have invested in our vision to revolutionize how data protection management and compliance measures are handled sustainably
For Sports Enthusiasts: We subsidize your Wellpass membership for your physical fitness for a better work-life balance
Teamwork Makes the Dream Work: We are a strong team that supports each other, and we also have a lot of fun together beyond work and across different locations


Sounds like you are the one we’ve been looking for?

Perfect, let's have a chat! Just send in your CV. We are excited to meet you soon.

In case you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Lena from our People & Culture team. She's happy to answer all your questions.

About Us

At Kertos, we've made it our mission to develop Europe's first compliance automation system to enhance compliance operations for everyone. We are a technology company, founded in 2021, providing a novel no-code system integration solution for data privacy operations and requirements. Our platforms offers complete automation of data privacy functions, including deletion concepts, access requests, and RoPAs, all with just one click. Backed by some of the most renowned VCs and Business Angels, we are looking for passionate individuals to grow our team and rethink data privacy with us. Join us on our ride toward the future of compliance!
Show more

Title: (Junior) AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Schließe dich unserem innovativen KI-Squad bei Media Impact an, in dem du entscheidend an der Optimierung interner Prozesse und der Verbesserung unserer Produkte durch künstliche Intelligenz beteiligt bist. Diese Rolle eignet sich perfekt für kreative Köpfe, die modernste KI-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Medienumfeld umsetzen möchten.

Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Lead AI Engineer an MIA (Media Impact Assistant) zusammen, einem fortschrittlichen internen Chatbot, der in Microsoft Teams integriert ist. MIA agiert als virtuelle Kollegin, die natürliche Sprachabfragen verstehen kann, um schnelle, präzise und aufschlussreiche Antworten zu liefern. Dadurch werden die Produktivität gesteigert und Arbeitsabläufe für unser Verkaufs- und Operationsteam optimiert.

Become a

Teil unseres KI-Squads



du arbeitest mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um deren Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und Möglichkeiten zur KI-Integration zu finden
du wirkst mit bei der Konzeption und Implementierung von KI-Lösungen, mit besonderem Fokus auf MIA, unserem internen Chatbot-Assistenten
du entwickelst und integrierst zusätzliche Module zur Verbesserung der bestehenden NLP-Fähigkeiten von MIA
du unterstützt bei der Implementierung von Algorithmen zum Auslesen und Verarbeiten von PDF-Dokumenten
du nutzt Cloud-Computing-Technologien wie Azure oder AWS zur Bereitstellung und Administration von KI-Lösungen




You are a

Berufseinsteiger mit Interesse und Leidenschaft für Künstliche Intelligenz



du hast dein Studium in Informatik, Computer Science oder einem verwandten Bereich mit Schwerpunkt auf KI, Machine Learning oder Data Science erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder relevante Erfahrung in diesen Bereichen
du beherrschst Programmiersprachen wie Python, Java oder R
du bist vertraut im Umgang mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud
du hast ein ausgeprägtes Interesse komplexe Probleme zu finden und mithilfe von KI zu lösen
du arbeitest gut im Team, kannst komplexe Sachverhalte klar vermitteln und engagierst dich für einen ethischen, transparenten und verantwortungsvollen Einsatz von KI
du hast solide Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (jew. mindestens C1)




Benefit from a

spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Job bei Deutschlands schnellstem und kreativstem Kundenversteher



flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten ermöglichen dir eine ideale Work-Life-Balance
FreeLunch! - erhalte täglich ein kostenloses Mittagessen in einem der großartigen Kiezrestaurants
never stop learning! Nutze unsere vielfältigen Lerninhalte und -angebote für deine persönliche Weiterentwicklung
Mitarbeiter-Angebote, die zu dir und deiner Lebenssituation passen: Ob vergünstigtes Deutschland-Ticket oder JobRad-Leasing, Fahrradgarage (inkl. regelmäßigem Fahrradservice), Kinderbetreuungsangebote oder ein moderner Kindergarten im Haus
freue dich auf ein diverses und aufgeschlossenes Arbeitsumfeld mit verschiedenen Communities und Interessensgruppen, in denen du dich aktiv einbringen kannst
wir bieten dir ab sofort eine auf zunächst 12 Monate befristete Position in Vollzeit oder Teilzeit




Fragen und Antworten zum Bewerbungsprozess

Ansprechpartner für diese Position (Referenznummer REF2021D) ist: Florian Jänchen

Die häufigsten Fragen und Antworten findest du in unseren FAQs: career.axelspringer.com/de/faq

Um den Lesefluss zu erleichtern, beschränken wir uns im Textverlauf auf männliche Bezeichnungen. Dennoch ist Vielfalt (Diversity) ein wesentlicher Teil unserer Unternehmenskultur! Wir freuen uns unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität auf alle Bewerbungen.

Informationen zur Schwerbehindertenvertretung bei Axel Springer findest du hier: career.axelspringer.com/de/ksbv

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Lockers
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.


About You


Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.

In this position, you’ll

  • Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
  • Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
  • Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
  • Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
  • Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
  • Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
  • Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.

About You

  • Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
  • Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
  • Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
  • Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
  • Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
  • Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
  • Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
  • Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
  • Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

Join eBay's innovative team that stands at the intersection of cutting-edge machine learning technology and e-commerce. Our team is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive culture where creativity and collaboration drive the development of intelligent systems that enhance the global online marketplace. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will have a significant role in designing and developing machine learning systems, which involves assessing and organizing data, driving tests and experiments, and generally monitoring and optimizing machine learning processes to help develop strong performing machine learning systems. You will collaborate closely with multi-functional teams including managers, developers, business analysts and data scientists to deliver products and services that leverage machine learning techniques.

What You Will Accomplish


Designing, developing, and researching Machine Learning systems, models
Studying, transforming, and converting data science prototypes
Searching and selecting appropriate data sets before performing data collection and data modeling
Performing statistical analysis and using results to improve models
Training and retraining machine learning systems and models as needed, monitor quality of the models in production
Identifying differences in data distribution that could affect model performance in real-world situations
Visualizing data for deeper insights
Analyzing the use cases of machine learning algorithms and ranking them by their success probability
Enriching existing machine learning frameworks and libraries
Verifying data quality and/or ensuring it via data cleaning



What You Will Bring


Proven experience in building machine learning models in computer vision or natural language processing related fields
Experience in modern ML tooling related to experiment management, containerization, orchestration, processing pipelines and data version control
Experience in bringing ML models in production, monitoring and maintaining them throughout their entire life cycle. Familiarity with DevOps and MLOps cultures
Proficient in Python for scripting and data manipulation tasks and software development best practices
Proficient in SQL for querying and managing databases
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Fluent spoken and written English



What Sets You Apart


Proven track record in leading multi-functional teams and collaborating effectively with partners at different levels of the organization
Experience with PyTorch, Google Cloud, Kubeflow, AirFlow, ElasticSearch
A coaching & knowledge sharing mindset
Experience in working with crowdsourcing approaches for collecting datasets
Experience in mentoring junior positions and collaboration with data analytics or data engineers on the projects
Experience in working remotely



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.
