Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you’ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team’s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is €69,000 - €93,400 gross per year.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)
Description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)

Develop innovative machine learning solutions to analyze biomedical datasets of different modalities with the goal of designing optimized molecules and improving our understanding of targets, diseases and patients.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary and cross-organizational team
You will develop and evaluate state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms applied to modelling protein-ligand and protein-protein complexes
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout R&D to ensure innovative algorithmic solutions are operationalized and integrated into our discovery pipelines
You will keep up to date with the latest advances in machine learning technologies
You will engage with the broader scientific community through publications, open-source projects, and conference presentations


Who You Are

We are excited about your talent and passion for this position. Attracting the right talent is important to us. We would be happy to work with you to identify and create the career and development opportunities you are looking for - also in parttime. And if you don't meet all the requirements, we still look forward to receiving your application. We are all constantly learning!

Required:


You have a highly scientific or engineering background, with a PhD degree or equivalent
You have expertise in machine learning research
You have a sincere interest for drug discovery and the life sciences
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Preferred:


You have expertise in bioinformatics or structural biology
You are an expert in applying machine learning for characterizing and designing small molecules, DNA/RNA, or proteins
You have expertise in applying, dissecting, and improving upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Knowledge of modern generative modelling methods (e.g., diffusion), protein language models (e.g., ESM), modern structure prediction methods (e.g., AlphaFold), or experience efficiently training and fine-tuning large models are a big plus
You have excellent software engineering skills
You have a strong publication record or demonstrated contributions (e.g., open source) for the above


What We Offer

Our benefits package is flexible, appreciative, and tailored to your lifestyle, because: What matters to you, matters to us!


We ensure your financial stability through a competitive compensation package, consisting of an attractive base pay and our annual bonus. In addition, managers can recognize special contributions by granting an individual performance award or top performance award.
Whether it’s hybrid work models or part-time arrangements: Whenever it is possible, you will have the flexibility to work how, when and where it is best for you.
Your family is a top priority. We offer loving company daycare centers at multiple locations, support in finding childcare, time off for the care of elderly or dependent family members, summer camps for children, and much more.
We support your professional growth by providing access to learning and development opportunities, training programs through the Bayer Learning Academy, development dialogues, as well as coaching and mentoring programs.
We promote health awareness and opportunities for selfcare through various measures, such as free health checks with the company doctor and our health platform #machfit.
We embrace diversity by providing an inclusive work environment in which you are welcomed, supported, and encouraged to bring your whole self to work.


The position is limited to two years.

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Location:

Germany : Berlin : Berlin || Germany : North Rhine Westfalia : Monheim

Division:

Pharmaceuticals

Reference Code:

822732

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d) Siemens Historical Institute
Description:
Über uns.

Als Teil unserer globalen Brand-Abteilung sind wir vom Siemens Historical Institute (SHI) dafür verantwortlich, das historische Erbe von Siemens zu bewahren und zu pflegen. Wir arbeiten daran, unsere IT-Systeme zu modernisieren und zukunftssicher zu machen, um die Effizienz und Produktivität unseres Archivs zu steigern.

Bist du bereit, Teil eines zukunftsorientierten Teams zu werden und eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Modernisierung unserer IT-Landschaft zu übernehmen? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Deine Tätigkeiten.


Prozesserstellung: Entwickeln und Standardisieren von Schnittstellen und Prozessen für die Akquisition, Archivierung und Verwaltung digitaler Assets sowie kontinuierliche Prozessoptimierung
Automatisierung: Einführung und Einsatz von Künstlicher Intelligenz zur automatischen Beschreibung und Zusammenfassung von Dokumenten, AV- und Social Media-Assets
Administrationstätigkeiten: Verwaltung und Betreuung der IT-Infrastruktur sowie Archivsoftware-Lösungen, um einen stabilen und zuverlässigen Betrieb sicherzustellen
Cyber-Security: Verantwortung und Umsetzung der relevanten Cyber-Security Bestimmungen und Prozesse sowie die Erstellung und Überwachung von Datenschutz- und Sicherheitsrichtlinien
Dokumentation: Erstellung und Pflege technischer Dokumentationen und administrativer Einträge in Siemens IT-Tools
Kostenmanagement: Planung, Budgetierung und Überwachung des IT-Projektbudgets
Stakeholder-Management: Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern, um den reibungslosen Datenaustausch zu gewährleisten
Entwicklung von Lösungen: Implementierung von Cloud-basierten Archiven für unterschiedliche Datenkategorien und Schaffung effektiver Klassifikations- und Ordnungssysteme
Projektmanagement: Unterstützen und Koordinieren von IT-Transformationsprojekten zur Modernisierung unserer IT-Landschaft und des digitalen Archivs
Migrationsplanung: Auswahl zukunftsfähiger Archivierungslösungen und Planung der Migration, einschließlich der Schulung und Unterstützung von SHI-Mitarbeitern


Deine Qualifikationen.


Ausbildung: Abgeschlossenes Bachelor-Studium im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem verwandten Feld
Berufserfahrung: Langjährige Tätigkeit in den Bereichen Data Science, Data Analytics und Archivierung
Kenntnisse: Ausgeprägte Kenntnisse in Cloud-Technologien, IT-Infrastrukturen und Archivsoftware sowie Kenntnisse über Cyber-Security Bestimmungen sowie Bereitschaft sich in das IT Umfeld eines globalen Konzerns einzuarbeiten
Technische Kenntnisse: Praxiserfahrung mit Digitalisierungstechnologien, Integration verschiedener IT-Anwendungen und dem Einsatz von KI-Technologien
Stärken: Ausgeprägte analytische und organisatorische Fähigkeiten, strategisches Denkvermögen, exzellente Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Teamfähigkeit
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind notwendig
Interesse: Begeisterung für die Geschichte des Unternehmens und Engagement, sich tief in die Materie einzuarbeiten


Was wir bieten.


Eine herausfordernde Tätigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld
Die Möglichkeit, an bedeutenden IT-Transformationsprojekten zu arbeiten
Ein engagiertes Team und eine offene Unternehmenskultur
2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

We’re looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to come aboard and be part of Data Applications built on Snowflake. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to uncover insights about how providers built data apps and customers use Snowflake and applications, helping to inform Product’s decision making and focus Engineering efforts. You will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and less structure that will yield substantial product enhancements. This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Snowflake products and services.

AS A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:


Drive high impactful initiatives for the global data application architecture and provide foundation for all critical telemetry and events to track data apps , its usage & consumption patterns
Innovate and build data platforms to store, analyze sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience.
Influence and collaborate closely with Engineers and Product Managers and executives to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers.
Build framework and foundational high quality data pipelines , inform engineering for relevant instrumentation of telemetry events and architect the right data model for the product.
Build native apps , dashboards/apps & analytical framework to help Engineering and Product Managers monitor performance and availability of our system.
Answer questions from the executive team for board reporting, publications, and industry reports.
Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.



OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:


MS/Ph.D. in quantitative discipline (Math, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering, or CS)
Expert-level experience working with SQL and relational data (8+ years on a regular basis).
8+ years of experience with Python, including scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas.
Expert in working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data).
Heavy fluency with MPP databases, such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, etc.
Data storytelling , analysis & learnings to business leaders and technical stakeholders.
The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
Must have prior experience in data application , apps , app store & marketplace.
Show more

Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

We’re looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to come aboard and be part of Data Applications built on Snowflake. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to uncover insights about how providers built data apps and customers use Snowflake and applications, helping to inform Product’s decision making and focus Engineering efforts. You will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and less structure that will yield substantial product enhancements. This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Snowflake products and services.

AS A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:

  • Drive high impactful initiatives for the global data application architecture and provide foundation for all critical telemetry and events to track data apps , its usage & consumption patterns
  • Innovate and build data platforms to store, analyze sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience.
  • Influence and collaborate closely with Engineers and Product Managers and executives to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers.
  • Build framework and foundational high quality data pipelines , inform engineering for relevant instrumentation of telemetry events and architect the right data model for the product.
  • Build native apps , dashboards/apps & analytical framework to help Engineering and Product Managers monitor performance and availability of our system.
  • Answer questions from the executive team for board reporting, publications, and industry reports.
  • Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.


OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:

  • MS/Ph.D. in quantitative discipline (Math, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering, or CS)
  • Expert-level experience working with SQL and relational data (8+ years on a regular basis).
  • 8+ years of experience with Python, including scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas.
  • Expert in working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data).
  • Heavy fluency with MPP databases, such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, etc.

  • The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
  • Must have prior experience in data application , apps , app store & marketplace.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Explore a new world of possibilities:

At HomeToGo, we’re on a mission to make incredible accommodation easily accessible for everyone. Our team is united by a passion for travel, driven by innovation and impact, and guided by open-minded leaders at every level. Our commitment to recognizing and empowering exceptional talent is the foundation of our growth. We are actively hiring candidates from all around the world, including sponsoring visas for Germany. An amazing journey of opportunity with an international team lies ahead - join us!

Your future contribution:

Which destinations or categories of rental homes should we recommend to customers when they browse our website or receive our newsletter? How can we provide the most relevant list of results in our vacation rental search? How can we account for market trends, inventory quality and customer behavior to dynamically improve our products?

HomeToGo’s Data Science team is responsible for supercharging our products, particularly in areas such as search, recommendations, marketing, overall integration of NLP/LLMs functionality like Entity and Topic extraction, as well as supporting planning with forecasting. Leveraging our extensive demand, product, and supply data, we aim to deliver engagement and revenue-driving intelligence using sophisticated ML models. We are seeking to bolster our Data Science team to elevate these efforts to the next level and expand into new use cases.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will collaborate with our talented team of Data Scientists and partner with colleagues in various departments, including Search, Marketing, Analytics, and Engineering, to enhance and expand our AI-powered marketplace. This presents an exciting opportunity to join a team that significantly impacts HomeToGo's overall performance. You will tackle challenging problems and drive measurable business impact through our online A/B testing platform.

How you’ll add value:



Help in shaping our long-term Data Science strategy; from use cases to capabilities like Semantic Search or Search/e-mail personalisation, topic and entity extraction for our sourcing/product/customer service teams or building core abilities around imagery handling or forecasting
Design quantitative models and improve existing models by designing new features (offline and online) to drive customer engagement, booking conversions and other key metrics, e.g. revenue per user, booking in last X days for our ranking
Ensure proper selection of model offline quality metrics and maintain an adequate level of model explainability to support operation teams
Ensure efficient and cohesive workflows in our Data Science efforts to maximize business impact, while acting as a valuable sparring partner and facilitator for other Data Scientists
Serve as a consultative and creative partner for business and product stakeholders – understanding their needs and translating them into modeling problems



You’ll be successful in this role if you:



Have a proven track record as a Data Scientist in e-commerce or other modern digital services; Having experience in areas of Ranking, Recommender Systems or similar is a plus
Hold an MSc or PhD, with a strong academic record, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or another quantitative field
Have extensive hands-on experience in product analytics and A/B testing,, advanced modeling and ML, with a high comfort level using Python and SQL
Be able to blend into a technical environment using git, Docker, CI/CD and co.
Are familiar with modern large-scale data warehousing solutions (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery) and/or data processing engines (e.g. Spark, Presto) – ideally in the context of distributed cloud computing (e.g. AWS, GCP).
Have experience driving Data Science projects end to end, from the ideation to the proof-of-concept to the productionalization
Have the ability to thrive in a cross-functional setting: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize takeaways for non-technical partners, and a desire to influence business decisions
Bring intellectual curiosity, a desire for continuous learning, outcome orientation and a collaborative team-player attitude



Why HomeToGo?

Your journey with HomeToGo is a two way street - we’ve got you covered! We offer a diverse variety of benefits to enable your career development and make HomeToGo a great place to work, including:



The essentials: Competitive compensation package, visa sponsorship & relocation assistance*, full IT support & equipment, corporate benefits, modern offices, 27 paid vacation days a year (+ one additional day per year of employment until 32)
Career growth: 360° feedback, open feedback culture, buddy and mentorship programs from an international team of passionate industry experts
Personal development: German & Lithuanian language courses, internal and external workshops & trainings, company & team events, Gympass, clubs & sports (e.g. volleyball, running, yoga classes), psychological support
Startup spirit: Driven by our Leadership Principles: We are fast, nimble, and results-driven - embodying a startup mentality even as a global, public company. We encourage ownership and enable each other to succeed
Flexible work approach: Office-led and remote friendly approach; employees are offered remote work flexibility for up to 50% of the year, including work from abroad benefits. Plus, access to a Travel Industry Card
Climate action: Committed to being a pioneer in green travel: We’ve achieved an industry-leading “Low Risk” ESG Rating (16), awarded by Morningstar Sustainalytics, and are a proud member of Leaders for Climate Action
And so much more…
Certain conditions apply



About us:

HomeToGo is the SaaS-enabled marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.

Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, atraveo, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Kurzurlaub, Kurz Mal Weg, Tripping.com and Wimdu.

HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!

Which destinations or categories of rental homes should we recommend to customers when they browse our website or receive our newsletter? How can we provide the most relevant list of results in our vacation rental search? How can we account for market trends, inventory quality and customer behavior to dynamically improve our products?

HomeToGo’s Data Science team is responsible for supercharging our products, particularly in areas such as search, recommendations, marketing, overall integration of NLP/LLMs functionality like Entity and Topic extraction, as well as supporting planning with forecasting. Leveraging our extensive demand, product, and supply data, we aim to deliver engagement and revenue-driving intelligence using sophisticated ML models. We are seeking to bolster our Data Science team to elevate these efforts to the next level and expand into new use cases.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will collaborate with our talented team of Data Scientists and partner with colleagues in various departments, including Search, Marketing, Analytics, and Engineering, to enhance and expand our AI-powered marketplace. This presents an exciting opportunity to join a team that significantly impacts HomeToGo's overall performance. You will tackle challenging problems and drive measurable business impact through our online A/B testing platform.

How you’ll add value:


  • Help in shaping our long-term Data Science strategy; from use cases to capabilities like Semantic Search or Search/e-mail personalisation, topic and entity extraction for our sourcing/product/customer service teams or building core abilities around imagery handling or forecasting
  • Design quantitative models and improve existing models by designing new features (offline and online) to drive customer engagement, booking conversions and other key metrics, e.g. revenue per user, booking in last X days for our ranking
  • Ensure proper selection of model offline quality metrics and maintain an adequate level of model explainability to support operation teams
  • Ensure efficient and cohesive workflows in our Data Science efforts to maximize business impact, while acting as a valuable sparring partner and facilitator for other Data Scientists
  • Serve as a consultative and creative partner for business and product stakeholders – understanding their needs and translating them into modeling problems


You’ll be successful in this role if you:


  • Have a proven track record as a Data Scientist in e-commerce or other modern digital services; Having experience in areas of Ranking, Recommender Systems or similar is a plus
  • Hold an MSc or PhD, with a strong academic record, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or another quantitative field
  • Have extensive hands-on experience in product analytics and A/B testing,, advanced modeling and ML, with a high comfort level using Python and SQL
  • Be able to blend into a technical environment using git, Docker, CI/CD and co.
  • Are familiar with modern large-scale data warehousing solutions (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery) and/or data processing engines (e.g. Spark, Presto) – ideally in the context of distributed cloud computing (e.g. AWS, GCP).
  • Have experience driving Data Science projects end to end, from the ideation to the proof-of-concept to the productionalization
  • Have the ability to thrive in a cross-functional setting: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize takeaways for non-technical partners, and a desire to influence business decisions
  • Bring intellectual curiosity, a desire for continuous learning, outcome orientation and a collaborative team-player attitude


Why HomeToGo?

Your journey with HomeToGo is a two way street - we’ve got you covered! We offer a diverse variety of benefits to enable your career development and make HomeToGo a great place to work, including:


  • The essentials: Competitive compensation package, visa sponsorship & relocation assistance*, full IT support & equipment, corporate benefits, modern offices, 27 paid vacation days a year (+ one additional day per year of employment until 32)
  • Career growth: 360° feedback, open feedback culture, buddy and mentorship programs from an international team of passionate industry experts
  • Personal development: German & Lithuanian language courses, internal and external workshops & trainings, company & team events, Gympass, clubs & sports (e.g. volleyball, running, yoga classes), psychological support
  • Startup spirit: Driven by our Leadership Principles: We are fast, nimble, and results-driven - embodying a startup mentality even as a global, public company. We encourage ownership and enable each other to succeed
  • Flexible work approach: Office-led and remote friendly approach; employees are offered remote work flexibility for up to 50% of the year, including work from abroad benefits. Plus, access to a Travel Industry Card
  • Climate action: Committed to being a pioneer in green travel: We’ve achieved an industry-leading “Low Risk” ESG Rating (16), awarded by Morningstar Sustainalytics, and are a proud member of Leaders for Climate Action
  • And so much more…
  • Certain conditions apply


About us:

HomeToGo is the SaaS-enabled marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.

Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, atraveo, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Kurzurlaub, Kurz Mal Weg, Tripping.com and Wimdu.

HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!

Title: AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Die Cornelsen Gruppe mit Hauptsitz in Berlin zählt mit Marken wie Cornelsen, Duden, Cornelsen eCademy & inside, Cornelsen Experimenta sowie Veritas und dem Verlag an der Ruhr seit mehr als 75 Jahren zu den führenden Anbietern auf dem deutschsprachigen Bildungsmarkt. Mit über 1.600 Mitarbeiter*innen entwickeln wir innovative crossmediale Bildungslösungen von der frühen Kindheit bis ins Erwachsenen- und Berufsleben. Gemeinsam gestalten wir die Bildung von morgen und leisten einen sinnvollen Beitrag in einem Umfeld mit hoher gesellschaftlicher Relevanz.Bei uns kannst du etwas bewegen und dein Potenzial entfalten. Werde Teil unseres Teams!Für unser Team AI Products & Services suchen wir am Standort Berlin unbefristet in Voll- oder Teilzeit zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n AI Engineer (m/w/d).

Deine Aufgaben
Als Mitglied unseres Bereichs AI Products & Services unterstützt du bei der Entwicklung innovativer Produkte und moderner KI-Anwendungen für den Einsatz in Schulen
Du entwickelst und implementierst KI-Lösungen, die unsere Kund*innen befähigen, ihre Arbeit effizienter und qualitativ hochwertiger zu gestalten, und hilfst damit die Qualität der Bildung zu verbessern
Du scheust dich nicht, im Maschinenraum von KI-Anwendungen dafür zu sorgen, dass die KI-Anwendungen flüssig und stabil laufen
Du prüfst und optimierst die entwickelten KI-Lösungen basierend auf Feedback von Nutzer*innen und Leistungskennzahlen
Du lebst den agilen Entwicklungsprozess, bei dem du mitdenkst und deine Ideen und Expertise in eine offene Fehlerkultur einbringst
KI-Lösungen schließen Eigenentwicklungen ein, wobei du beim gesamten Machine Learning Prozess unterstützt: vom Sammeln und Aufbereiten der Daten, über das Trainieren, und Evaluieren der Modelle bis hin zum Einsatz dieser in produktiver Umgebung
Dein Profil
Du hast ein Interesse für KI-Anwendungen im Bereich Linguistik / Natural Language Processing im Bereich Bildung und Fremdsprachen
Du bringst mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von KI-Lösungen oder dem praktischen Einsatz von maschinellem Lernen in der Cloud (AWS, Azure, OpenAI, o. Ä.) mit
Du hast einen Studienabschluss in Informatik, KI, Maschinellem Lernen, Data Science oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Du bringst solide Software-Engineering-Fähigkeiten mit und hast Kenntnisse in Design Patterns, Clean Code, SCRUM-Entwicklungsprozess und Test-Driven-Development (TDD)
Du kennst dich sehr gut in der Programmiersprache Python aus und bist mit Frameworks wie FastAPI, LangChain, spaCy, PyTorch, TensorFlow vertraut
Eine eigenverantwortliche und pragmatische Arbeitsweise sowie die Motivation zur stetigen Weiterbildung zeichen dich aus
Du hast sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse (jeweils mind. C1)
Du bist außergewöhnlich empathisch mit dir selbst, deinen Kolleg*innen und deiner Zielgruppe
Unser Angebot
Gestalte die Zukunft der Bildung in einem sinnstiftenden Umfeld
Erlebe optimale Work-Life-Balance mit 30 Tagen Urlaub und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Arbeite flexibel mobil bis zu 4 Tage pro Woche und genieße bis zu 20 Tage Workation in Europa (EWR) pro Jahr
Arbeite agil in dynamischen und crossfunktionalen Teams
Stärke deine Gesundheit und dein Wohlbefinden mit unserer Work-Life-Plattform evermood
Profitiere von attraktiven Vorteilen wie Kita- und Hort-Zuschuss, Rabatte auf Bücher, betrieblicher Altersvorsorge und vermögenswirksamen Leistungen
Setze auf nachhaltige Mobilität mit Dienstrad-Leasing und reduziertem Deutschlandticket – gut für dich und unsere Umwelt
Genieße biologisch-regionales Essen in unserer hauseigenen Kantine bei gemeinsamen Mittagessen mit deinen Kolleg*innen
Entfalte dein Potenzial durch persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten (Weiterbildungen, Fachkonferenzen, E-Learnings & Networking)
Erlebe starken Teamgeist bei Sportveranstaltungen, Events und Mitarbeiter*innenfesten

Cornelsen setzt sich für Chancengleichheit, Vielfalt und Integration am Arbeitsplatz ein. Wir unterbinden Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeder Art aufgrund von Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Religion, sexueller Orientierung, Herkunft, Behinderung, geschlechtlicher Identität oder anderen geschützten Merkmalen.Ihr findet auf unserer Karriereseite ausschließlich waschechte Cornelsianer*innen! Noch sind wir nicht so divers, wie wir es gerne wären, D&I ist uns aber ein sehr großes Anliegen.

Deine Ansprechpartner*innen
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Berlin, Hybrid)
Description:
We're currently in a growth phase after Series B funding and are looking for people who can join us as soon as possible.

A Little About Us


Kittl isn’t just another design platform: We’re here to transform the way creators work, offering an intuitive platform as a competitive alternative to clunky and outdated traditional design tools
Boasting millions of users only 2 years after launch
Diverse team: 100+ team members from 25+ different countries
Product-led: Product managers, engineers, and designers are at the heart of Kittl
Funding: Kittl has raised more than $50M from some of the most prestigious investors in the world that also have backed companies like Slack, Dropbox and Figma.


We have a hybrid working culture with 3 days per week as office days in our Berlin headquarters. We're growing London as our second location, with an office in London coming by the end of 2024.

Learn more: www.kittl.com/career

Your role at Kittl

Our data function is a small, dedicated team but now ready to grow and evolve; so you’ll be making a huge impact. Kittl is scaling fast, and the need for data-driven insights and product development is becoming increasingly important.

As a Senior Data Scientist you’ll be instrumental in supporting the product teams with making the right decisions to continue Kittl’s growth. You will be forecasting and predicting the value that our tools deliver to our users. You will also lead the data team in developing practical machine learning applications in order to enable innovative and customer-facing product features. In doing so, you will have a proven impact on bringing Kittl’s mission to life.

While experience is valuable, we prioritise drive, intelligence, and integrity. If you embody these qualities, we encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every requirement.

What You'll Do


Data Analysis & Modeling: Use statistical methods to analyse data and generate useful business insights for our product teams.
Ideation & KPI setting: Forming ideas and acting as a key strategic partner to product teams as we define roadmaps. You’ll be the person closest to the data and have a unique perspective on how users are interacting with different aspects of our product. With this knowledge, you will work closely with product managers and leadership to define the development roadmap for different areas of the Kittl platform.
Ownership: Owning projects, data models, dashboards, and other artefacts and keeping them up-to-date and of high quality in a hyper growth environment
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyse A/B tests and other experiments to optimise user conversion and retention.
Model Development: as we scale, the need for advanced ML models is growing. We already have multiple projects in the pipeline, and you will lead the development of these.
Data Culture: Maintain a culture of rigour and data-informed decision making to drive tangible business impact


What You’ll Need


Experience: 4+ years of experience developing and productionising Machine Learning models within fast-moving SaaS companies
A/B testing: Experience setting up A/B tests, interpreting results, and measuring the business impact
Cloud: Practical experience training models in a Cloud Environment (eg: AWS Sagemaker, Azure ML Studio, or GCP)
Big data processing: Hands-on experience with big data processing / distributed data pipelines and tools such as Apache Airflow and Spark
Python: Proficiency in programming in Python, software design, version control and code reviews
Soft skills: Good communication skills and comfortable explaining complex ideas, with the ability to work in a collaborative environment where priorities and requirements may change in a short notice
LLMs: Experience with training or fine-tuning AI models (LLMs) is a plus


Interview process


Recruiter interview (30 minutes)
Hiring manager interview (45 minutes)
Take home case study (5 days)
Case study presentation with Senior Data Scientist and Senior Product Manager (45 minutes)
Bar raiser interview with Founders Associate, right hand to CEO (30 minutes)


Benefits


Urban Sports Club membership discount
Mobility benefit: monthly public transport (BVG) ticket fully covered by the company
German language courses subsidised by the company
30 vacation days per year for all employees
An allowance of 50 working days per year (10 weeks, if you count the weekend) of fully remote work from anywhere in the world, as long as you maintain common working hours (12pm to 5pm CET)
We have a hybrid setup with an office in Berlin, and work-from-home days so that we can foster a nice culture and in-person collaboration when needed
Common working hours are 12pm to 5pm CET, with the rest of your working time being flexible so you can work in a style that suits you best (early riser or a night owl)
You'll be working with a truly product-led company with PM's, engineers and designers at the heart of the company
Regular team events and offsites


🌈 At Kittl, we embrace diversity and value every team member's unique background, identity, and experience. We're all about respect, honesty, and inclusivity. Together, we create a safe and supportive work environment where everyone thrives. Join us on this exciting journey of making our company and product even better!

🌈 At Kittl, we embrace diversity and value every team member's unique background, identity, and experience. We're all about respect, honesty, and inclusivity. Together, we create a safe and supportive work environment where everyone thrives. Join us on this exciting journey of making our company and product even better!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Marketing Science
Description:
Smartly has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Marketing Science focussed Data Scientist to join our growing Performance team in EMEA.

We are looking for a customer-facing data scientist who enjoys analyzing sophisticated systems and can communicate findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. Your role is crucial in making sure we can systematically improve optimization across our customers!

You will work with our distributed team of customer-facing data scientists based in our offices in Helsinki, New York, and San Francisco. In this role you will analyze, validate, and test standard methodologies in paid social advertising. You will be working closely together with both product development and commercial colleagues.

As a Marketing Science Data Scientist you will...


Perform quantitative research to support sales and marketing proof points
Drive thought leadership in the areas of optimization, testing, attribution and market insights within the Smartly organization and across the customer base
Perform performance meta analyses, vertical research, and playbooks based on scientifically sound analytics
Serve as the day-to-day trusted measurement consultant for key strategic advertisers by analyzing customers’ performance marketing data and develop methods to determine what works and, more meaningfully, why it works
Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products



What We Are Looking For...


5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)



Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.


Show more

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
  • Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
  • Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)


Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Investment Modeling
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Investment Modeling team to build quantitative growth models and optimise investments across hundreds of cities around the world!

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building forecasting models to predict the short and long-term impact of incentives on growth of the business. You will use an optimization techniques to distribute incentives over time periods, across different cities and channels to maximize the growth of the business. As a Data Scientist you will be building products powered by Data Science models for internal teams to use in portfolio planning and budgeting. In addition you will work on decomposing and modeling business growth by interpretable and actionable components

Your daily adventures will include:


Develop a deep understanding of technical and business needs to solve real-world problems end-to-end
Research, test and apply novel forecasting techniques and methods
Develop and maintain predictive models to ensure accurate forecasts at short and long horizons for multiple business verticals
Quickly deploy models to production using AWS and internal machine learning platform
Solve optimization problems for incentives budget allocation within local and global constraints.
Communicate and present results to product and business stakeholders
Work with Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow
Work with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in cross-functional feature teams
Regularly exchange knowledge with Data Scientists at various levels of seniority in the company



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (3+ years recommended)
Natural curiosity to identify problems, explore trends and discover opportunities with little supervision
Capability to approach problems with first principles thinking
Team player with strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Experience in time series analysis, modeling multivariate time series, familiarity with forecasting techniques
Experience in Python programming, including libraries like Pandas, Numpy, sklearn, OR-tools
Understanding and practical experience with statistical hypothesis testing
You will get extra credits for product development experience in a technology company
You will get extra credits for Ph.D in a quantitative field (physics, mathematics, computer science, economics)
You will get extra credits for an experience with multivariate time series forecasting methods



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
Show more

Title: Senior IoT Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a dynamic Green Tech IoT company based in the heart of Berlin, seeking a talented and passionate Senior/Lead Data Scientist to join their team. They are developing innovative solutions to address pressing environmental challenges through the power of Wildfire Detection.




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in unlocking the potential of our data, driving product innovation, and shaping our company's growth.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement robust data pipelines to efficiently process and transform large volumes of sensor data.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform product development and business strategy.
Build predictive models to optimise system performance, enhance user experience, and drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to drive innovation.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proficient in Python.
Strong experience with machine learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn.
Strong experience with modelling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.
Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques: PCA, T-SNE, k-means clustering.
Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




What they offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package plus stock
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with a high impact
Collaborative and inspiring work environment
Flexible work arrangements
Continuous learning and development opportunities




If you are a data scientist with a passion for sustainability and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply! Join us in building a greener future.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Picsart is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst. The Senior Data Analyst role will lead strategic business decisions by developing and providing data analysis and reporting of complex patterns, insights and trends to internal stakeholders. These insights will help solve highly complex business problems, implement best practices and optimise business performance.

By joining us, you will benefit from


An honest, open culture that emphasises feedback and promotes professional and personal development.
Hybrid setup— our team is distributed worldwide, from Armenia to US, UK, Germany, Spain and Romania
Wellbeing benefits (including a monthly wellbeing fund)
Growing opportunities — based on your preference you can grow in the company as a people manager or as an individual contributor.
An environment that fosters innovation and creativity, a culture with the ability to pilot new trends


You will


Work with huge datasets - get, clean and analyze them, use advanced and predictive analytics to create reports and intuitive dashboards
Partner with Business and IT teams to understand data/reporting needs, offer solutions to address specific data/reporting challenges
Execute on business/technical requirements and build multi-purpose interactive dashboard solutions, based on gathered requirements
Visualize and make effective presentations to communicate complex findings in a structured way for non-technical audience
Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize user conversion and retention
Dig deeper into data and find reasons for trends, and metrics changes
Integrate new tools to solve problems more effectively when needed
Define the underlying architecture of data collection and ensure data consistency and accuracy during the transformation process.


About You


BS/MA degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field
3-5 years experience in an analytics or data science position working with large data sets from enterprise database platforms, business intelligence development tools to solve complex business problems
Excellent knowledge of data manipulation languages such as SQL, Python (Pandas, visualization and statistical libraries, etc.)
Strong experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions and explains the whys, utilizing tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manage data collection process, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail
Strong synthesis skills with the ability to analyze huge amount of data and extract insights that will drive the product
Excellent communication and knowledge sharing skills to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated, quick learner and innovative person
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
Detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced written and verbal English communication skills.


What we seek and value most in our candidates

Professionalism in both soft and hard skills; motivation to grow, learn and share, positive attitude, flexibility, transparency, ownership and the most important - passion and commitment.

Picsart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Picsart, Inc. is an E-Verify Employer in the US. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in English or Spanish. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for English or Spanish.

For Applicants Based in California - California Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://rb.gy/lqu5mv)

About Us

Picsart is the world’s largest digital creation platform and a top 20 most downloaded app. Every month, the Picsart community creates, remixes, and shares billions of visual stories using the company’s powerful and easy-to-use editing tools. Picsart has amassed one of the largest open-source content collections in the world, including free-to-edit photos, stickers, backgrounds, templates, and more. Picsart is available in 30 languages for free and as a subscription on iOS, Android, Windows devices and on the Web. Headquartered in Miami, with offices around the world, Picsart is backed by SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, DCM Ventures, Insight Partners, and others. Download the app or visit picsart.com for more information.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 45+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting user and market behaviour under different circumstances, such as incentives, competitors' activity, and seasonality. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns distribution and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on uplift modelling topics to help shaping the most efficient campaign offerings.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results and communicating to stakeholders
Working closely with the Experimentation team to figure out robust design of campaigns experiments
Studying historical user behaviour data to identify opportunities for optimisation
Building models for optimal users’ discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in feature teams



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended)
Practical experience setting A/B tests and interpreting results
Deep understanding the theory behind statistical hypothesis testing
Profound knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Track record of deploying models to production and measuring the impact
Strong product thinking, ability to communicate and persuade, problem-solving
Experience writing complex SQL queries
Ability to map business and product problems on data science framework
Proactive mindset, willingness to take initiative and work with little supervision
Team player with excellent communication skills
You will get extra credits for experience in modelling and successful implementation of causal inference
You will get extra credits for Ph.D. in Computer Science, statistics, or related quantitative fields, or a Master's degree with equivalent industry experience
You will get extra credits for a background in econometrics, operations research, simulation or quantitative analysis of behaviour



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Ad Tech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world’s leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for Staff Data Scientists (all genders) to join the Ad Tech data science team in our mission to deliver consistently amazing experiences.

You will be a thought leader, driving innovation by designing and deploying our models to the forefront of technology to solve complex problems, delivering revenue for Delivery Hero at the frontline of our growth & profitability journey.

At Delivery Hero, AdTech introduces people to new food they love and enables our partners to meet their future customers at the perfect moment. We have developed a range of products to offer advertising solutions for restaurants helping them to increase their visibility and reach, improve their order conversion, and eventually drive more sales by covering the entire marketing funnel. Operating across over 50 countries around the clock, our Ad Tech connects the ideal advertiser with the ideal customer millions of times every day. In 2024/25, Ad Tech is a fundamental area for us on our path to profitability and is predicted to generate more than 1 billion euros in revenue for Delivery Hero; our data science team is at the heart of this growth, powering personalisation, relevance, and recommendation.

The Ad Tech data science team operates within the wider Vendor Data tribe whose mission is to drive innovation, insight-driven decision making and to solve business problems through a culture of excellence and openness. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions covering a host of business opportunities across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Spearhead a revolution of Ad Tech at Delivery Hero through the innovative application of cutting edge tools and techniques such as neural networks and reinforcement learning covering areas such as ad ranking, bidding strategies, and ad pacing driving unparalleled improvements in advertising campaigns.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve ad relevance, click-through rates, and conversion metrics.
Lead research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in AdTech and machine learning, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's advertising products and algorithms. Remain at the forefront of industry and research developments incorporating new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows and models.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science and machine learning, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data science team.


What you need to be successful


You are an industry-leading talent at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver enormous value to the business.
You raise the performance of other team members through effective and mature mentorship and constructive collaboration to benefit others from your deep understanding and experience of data science.
You have extensive expertise in building and training complex neural network models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit centering around deep learning i.e. Keras and ideally Tensorflow and TFX
Through the seamless use of SQL queries you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and are able to effectively set up your environment to minimise testing loops influencing the entire team to work more efficiently and reliably.
You are familiar with deploying and developing complex neural networks to serve live traffic and experience collaborating with ML engineers in cloud systems, ideally GCP.
You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from a variety of teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Implementing neural networks to specifically solve Ad Tech challenges would be highly desirable.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.
