We have developed a range of products to offer advertising solutions for restaurants helping them to increase their visibility and reach, improve their order conversion, and eventually drive more sales by covering the entire marketing funnel. Operating across over 50 countries around the clock, our Ad Tech connects the ideal advertiser with the ideal customer millions of times every day. In 2024/25, Ad Tech is a fundamental area for us on our path to profitability and is predicted to generate more than 1 billion euros in revenue for Delivery Hero; our data science team is at the heart of this growth, powering personalisation, relevance, and recommendation.

The Ad Tech data science team operates within the wider Vendor Data tribe whose mission is to drive innovation, insight-driven decision making and to solve business problems through a culture of excellence and openness. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions covering a host of business opportunities across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:

  • Spearhead a revolution of Ad Tech at Delivery Hero through the innovative application of cutting edge tools and techniques such as neural networks and reinforcement learning covering areas such as ad ranking, bidding strategies, and ad pacing driving unparalleled improvements in advertising campaigns.
  • Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve ad relevance, click-through rates, and conversion metrics.
  • Lead research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in AdTech and machine learning, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's advertising products and algorithms. Remain at the forefront of industry and research developments incorporating new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows and models.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert in data science and machine learning, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data science team.

What you need to be successful

  • You are an industry-leading talent at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver enormous value to the business.
  • You raise the performance of other team members through effective and mature mentorship and constructive collaboration to benefit others from your deep understanding and experience of data science.
  • You have extensive expertise in building and training complex neural network models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit centering around deep learning i.e. Keras and ideally Tensorflow and TFX
  • Through the seamless use of SQL queries you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine learning solutions.
  • You write clean, production-level code and are able to effectively set up your environment to minimise testing loops influencing the entire team to work more efficiently and reliably.
  • You are familiar with deploying and developing complex neural networks to serve live traffic and experience collaborating with ML engineers in cloud systems, ideally GCP.
  • You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
  • You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from a variety of teams in a diverse environment.

Nice to have:

  • Implementing neural networks to specifically solve Ad Tech challenges would be highly desirable.

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Robotics Engineer - AI
Description:
sensmore is a pioneering AI software automation company, focused on developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for heavy machinery in extreme conditions.

We specialize in AI-powered technologies that enhance understanding and operational intelligence in harsh environments, enabling advanced driver assistance and autonomous functions for industries like mining, construction, and agriculture.

Join us and play a pivotal role in transforming the automation landscape in heavy industries.

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled Robotics Engineer with expertise in AI to enhance our team. This role requires a strong background in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotics. The successful candidate will be instrumental in developing and refining AI-driven robotics systems that improve navigation and perception under challenging conditions.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement AI algorithms for robotic systems to improve perception and navigation capabilities.
Optimize and refine AI systems that leverage radar and other sensory technologies.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate these AI systems into larger robotic solutions.
Manage the full cycle of software development, from initial design through to implementation and ongoing maintenance.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in Python or C++.
Solid understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and robotics.
Practical experience with robotic perception and image processing.
Experience with frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.


Preferred Skills:


Practical experience with 3D vision in robotic applications.
Familiarity with multimodal machine learning models.
Knowledge of outdoor SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) techniques.
Experience with radar data or similar sensory inputs.
Proven track record of publications or significant industry experience in deep learning and AI.


What We Offer:


A dynamic startup environment where you can make a substantial impact.
Competitive salary with equity options.
Flexible hours and hybrid working arrangements to balance personal and professional life.
A diverse, innovative team committed to technological excellence and groundbreaking solutions.
Extensive opportunities for professional development in a fast-growing technology company.


Benefits:


Attractive compensation package and stock options.
Beverages on-site and regular social events.
Engage with top-tier researchers, engineers, and thought leaders.
Influence the future of robotic technologies and tackle significant technological challenges.
Assistance with relocation to Berlin.
Flexible schedules emphasizing quality and productivity.


About Us:

sensmore is comprised of a diverse group of individuals whose varied backgrounds and perspectives fuel our innovation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Although we support remote work, our culture thrives on in-person interactions, which we find essential for tackling the complex problems we face. Our policy requires team members to work onsite at least 50% of the time.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you’ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team’s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is €69,000 - €93,400 gross per year.
Show more

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)
Description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)

Develop innovative machine learning solutions to analyze biomedical datasets of different modalities with the goal of designing optimized molecules and improving our understanding of targets, diseases and patients.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary and cross-organizational team
You will develop and evaluate state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms applied to modelling protein-ligand and protein-protein complexes
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout R&D to ensure innovative algorithmic solutions are operationalized and integrated into our discovery pipelines
You will keep up to date with the latest advances in machine learning technologies
You will engage with the broader scientific community through publications, open-source projects, and conference presentations


Who You Are

We are excited about your talent and passion for this position. Attracting the right talent is important to us. We would be happy to work with you to identify and create the career and development opportunities you are looking for - also in parttime. And if you don't meet all the requirements, we still look forward to receiving your application. We are all constantly learning!

Required:


You have a highly scientific or engineering background, with a PhD degree or equivalent
You have expertise in machine learning research
You have a sincere interest for drug discovery and the life sciences
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Preferred:


You have expertise in bioinformatics or structural biology
You are an expert in applying machine learning for characterizing and designing small molecules, DNA/RNA, or proteins
You have expertise in applying, dissecting, and improving upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Knowledge of modern generative modelling methods (e.g., diffusion), protein language models (e.g., ESM), modern structure prediction methods (e.g., AlphaFold), or experience efficiently training and fine-tuning large models are a big plus
You have excellent software engineering skills
You have a strong publication record or demonstrated contributions (e.g., open source) for the above


What We Offer

Our benefits package is flexible, appreciative, and tailored to your lifestyle, because: What matters to you, matters to us!


We ensure your financial stability through a competitive compensation package, consisting of an attractive base pay and our annual bonus. In addition, managers can recognize special contributions by granting an individual performance award or top performance award.
Whether it’s hybrid work models or part-time arrangements: Whenever it is possible, you will have the flexibility to work how, when and where it is best for you.
Your family is a top priority. We offer loving company daycare centers at multiple locations, support in finding childcare, time off for the care of elderly or dependent family members, summer camps for children, and much more.
We support your professional growth by providing access to learning and development opportunities, training programs through the Bayer Learning Academy, development dialogues, as well as coaching and mentoring programs.
We promote health awareness and opportunities for selfcare through various measures, such as free health checks with the company doctor and our health platform #machfit.
We embrace diversity by providing an inclusive work environment in which you are welcomed, supported, and encouraged to bring your whole self to work.


The position is limited to two years.

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Location:

Germany : Berlin : Berlin || Germany : North Rhine Westfalia : Monheim

Division:

Pharmaceuticals

Reference Code:

822732

Title: Applied Scientist for Probabilistic Machine Learning and Human-Computer Interaction
Description:
Zander Labs is a leader in neuroadaptive technology, pioneering innovative solutions to enhance human-computer interaction. We are embarking on Project NAFAS, a landmark 30 million EUR initiative set to revolutionize the field.

We are seeking an innovative and skilled scientist with at least 1-3 years of experience and a specific combination of skills: The ideal candidate has profound knowledge of probabilistic machine learning modelling and of the application of these methods in the realm of (adaptive) human-computer interaction.

This particular position will focus on the design and development of neuroadaptive systems, i.e., systems that can adapt to the user's cognitive and emotional states in real time, based on a number of simultaneously obtained streams of data. The data in question will include decoded brain activity, discrete event markers of incidents within the environment, and many other continuous or discrete data points providing additional contextual information stemming from a virtual or real-life setting. The successful applicant must have prior experience with handling various time-series data, and will focus, among other things, on: the efficient and effective co-registration of the data and developing a probabilistic modelling framework; the conceptualization, design, and implementation of a comprehensive general framework to automatically find patterns and regularities in this data; and the deployment of that same framework to enable existing HCI implementations to detect and respond to such regularities, making them neuroadaptive. The end goal of this development is to provide the functionality necessary to meaningfully enhance user experience across various applications based on decoded brain activity, even when the exact interaction is not known or intentionally left open at design time. Therefore, a large weight is placed on creativity and ability to find new data-driven and/or machine learning modelling frameworks as well as designing, implementing, and validating proof-of-concept applications.

The successful candidate will apply their expert knowledge of probabilistic machine learning modelling and interactive systems to, among other things,


develop mathematical and probabilistic models of human-computer interactions and user behaviours,
develop methods to perform automatic inference,
design and develop experiments, prototypes, and proof-of-concept applications to evaluate, validate, and refine the developed methods,
write computer code, design experiments, and coordinate the necessary data acquisition,
conduct extensive research into existing HCI and adaptive systems,
collaborate with experts in different fields, including neuroscience, computer science, and machine learning to bring this technology closer to the market,
identify key use cases of emerging neuroadaptive capabilities,
stay abreast of the latest developments in HCI, neuroadaptive technology, and related fields.
Advanced degree in related field.
Strong modelling, analytical, programming, and system design skills.
Proven postgraduate experience in the field of computational modelling, mathematical modelling, or similar.
Demonstrable experience in the mathematical modelling and analysis of human-computer interaction and adaptation.
Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team and a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Familiarity with (passive) brain-computer interfaces is a plus.
Show more
HTML:
Zander Labs is a leader in neuroadaptive technology, pioneering innovative solutions to enhance human-computer interaction. We are embarking on Project NAFAS, a landmark 30 million EUR initiative set to revolutionize the field.

We are seeking an innovative and skilled scientist with at least 1-3 years of experience and a specific combination of skills: The ideal candidate has profound knowledge of probabilistic machine learning modelling and of the application of these methods in the realm of (adaptive) human-computer interaction.

This particular position will focus on the design and development of neuroadaptive systems, i.e., systems that can adapt to the user's cognitive and emotional states in real time, based on a number of simultaneously obtained streams of data. The data in question will include decoded brain activity, discrete event markers of incidents within the environment, and many other continuous or discrete data points providing additional contextual information stemming from a virtual or real-life setting. The successful applicant must have prior experience with handling various time-series data, and will focus, among other things, on: the efficient and effective co-registration of the data and developing a probabilistic modelling framework; the conceptualization, design, and implementation of a comprehensive general framework to automatically find patterns and regularities in this data; and the deployment of that same framework to enable existing HCI implementations to detect and respond to such regularities, making them neuroadaptive. The end goal of this development is to provide the functionality necessary to meaningfully enhance user experience across various applications based on decoded brain activity, even when the exact interaction is not known or intentionally left open at design time. Therefore, a large weight is placed on creativity and ability to find new data-driven and/or machine learning modelling frameworks as well as designing, implementing, and validating proof-of-concept applications.

The successful candidate will apply their expert knowledge of probabilistic machine learning modelling and interactive systems to, among other things,

  • develop mathematical and probabilistic models of human-computer interactions and user behaviours,
  • develop methods to perform automatic inference,
  • design and develop experiments, prototypes, and proof-of-concept applications to evaluate, validate, and refine the developed methods,
  • write computer code, design experiments, and coordinate the necessary data acquisition,
  • conduct extensive research into existing HCI and adaptive systems,
  • collaborate with experts in different fields, including neuroscience, computer science, and machine learning to bring this technology closer to the market,
  • identify key use cases of emerging neuroadaptive capabilities,
  • stay abreast of the latest developments in HCI, neuroadaptive technology, and related fields.
  • Advanced degree in related field.
  • Strong modelling, analytical, programming, and system design skills.
  • Proven postgraduate experience in the field of computational modelling, mathematical modelling, or similar.
  • Demonstrable experience in the mathematical modelling and analysis of human-computer interaction and adaptation.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team and a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Familiarity with (passive) brain-computer interfaces is a plus.

Title: AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Die Cornelsen Gruppe mit Hauptsitz in Berlin zählt mit Marken wie Cornelsen, Duden, Cornelsen eCademy & inside, Cornelsen Experimenta sowie Veritas und dem Verlag an der Ruhr seit mehr als 75 Jahren zu den führenden Anbietern auf dem deutschsprachigen Bildungsmarkt. Mit über 1.600 Mitarbeiter*innen entwickeln wir innovative crossmediale Bildungslösungen von der frühen Kindheit bis ins Erwachsenen- und Berufsleben. Gemeinsam gestalten wir die Bildung von morgen und leisten einen sinnvollen Beitrag in einem Umfeld mit hoher gesellschaftlicher Relevanz.Bei uns kannst du etwas bewegen und dein Potenzial entfalten. Werde Teil unseres Teams!Für unser Team AI Products & Services suchen wir am Standort Berlin unbefristet in Voll- oder Teilzeit zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n AI Engineer (m/w/d).

Deine Aufgaben
Als Mitglied unseres Bereichs AI Products & Services unterstützt du bei der Entwicklung innovativer Produkte und moderner KI-Anwendungen für den Einsatz in Schulen
Du entwickelst und implementierst KI-Lösungen, die unsere Kund*innen befähigen, ihre Arbeit effizienter und qualitativ hochwertiger zu gestalten, und hilfst damit die Qualität der Bildung zu verbessern
Du scheust dich nicht, im Maschinenraum von KI-Anwendungen dafür zu sorgen, dass die KI-Anwendungen flüssig und stabil laufen
Du prüfst und optimierst die entwickelten KI-Lösungen basierend auf Feedback von Nutzer*innen und Leistungskennzahlen
Du lebst den agilen Entwicklungsprozess, bei dem du mitdenkst und deine Ideen und Expertise in eine offene Fehlerkultur einbringst
KI-Lösungen schließen Eigenentwicklungen ein, wobei du beim gesamten Machine Learning Prozess unterstützt: vom Sammeln und Aufbereiten der Daten, über das Trainieren, und Evaluieren der Modelle bis hin zum Einsatz dieser in produktiver Umgebung
Dein Profil
Du hast ein Interesse für KI-Anwendungen im Bereich Linguistik / Natural Language Processing im Bereich Bildung und Fremdsprachen
Du bringst mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von KI-Lösungen oder dem praktischen Einsatz von maschinellem Lernen in der Cloud (AWS, Azure, OpenAI, o. Ä.) mit
Du hast einen Studienabschluss in Informatik, KI, Maschinellem Lernen, Data Science oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Du bringst solide Software-Engineering-Fähigkeiten mit und hast Kenntnisse in Design Patterns, Clean Code, SCRUM-Entwicklungsprozess und Test-Driven-Development (TDD)
Du kennst dich sehr gut in der Programmiersprache Python aus und bist mit Frameworks wie FastAPI, LangChain, spaCy, PyTorch, TensorFlow vertraut
Eine eigenverantwortliche und pragmatische Arbeitsweise sowie die Motivation zur stetigen Weiterbildung zeichen dich aus
Du hast sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse (jeweils mind. C1)
Du bist außergewöhnlich empathisch mit dir selbst, deinen Kolleg*innen und deiner Zielgruppe
Unser Angebot
Gestalte die Zukunft der Bildung in einem sinnstiftenden Umfeld
Erlebe optimale Work-Life-Balance mit 30 Tagen Urlaub und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Arbeite flexibel mobil bis zu 4 Tage pro Woche und genieße bis zu 20 Tage Workation in Europa (EWR) pro Jahr
Arbeite agil in dynamischen und crossfunktionalen Teams
Stärke deine Gesundheit und dein Wohlbefinden mit unserer Work-Life-Plattform evermood
Profitiere von attraktiven Vorteilen wie Kita- und Hort-Zuschuss, Rabatte auf Bücher, betrieblicher Altersvorsorge und vermögenswirksamen Leistungen
Setze auf nachhaltige Mobilität mit Dienstrad-Leasing und reduziertem Deutschlandticket – gut für dich und unsere Umwelt
Genieße biologisch-regionales Essen in unserer hauseigenen Kantine bei gemeinsamen Mittagessen mit deinen Kolleg*innen
Entfalte dein Potenzial durch persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten (Weiterbildungen, Fachkonferenzen, E-Learnings & Networking)
Erlebe starken Teamgeist bei Sportveranstaltungen, Events und Mitarbeiter*innenfesten

Cornelsen setzt sich für Chancengleichheit, Vielfalt und Integration am Arbeitsplatz ein. Wir unterbinden Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeder Art aufgrund von Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Religion, sexueller Orientierung, Herkunft, Behinderung, geschlechtlicher Identität oder anderen geschützten Merkmalen.Ihr findet auf unserer Karriereseite ausschließlich waschechte Cornelsianer*innen! Noch sind wir nicht so divers, wie wir es gerne wären, D&I ist uns aber ein sehr großes Anliegen.

Deine Ansprechpartner*innen

Title: Junior Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description:
Du bist auf der Suche nach einer spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeit im Bereich Entwicklung und Automatisierung?

Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Programmierung sammeln können und großes Interesse an Entwicklung von Automatisierungsprozessen. Du bist bereit, deine technischen Fähigkeiten und dein Know-how in einem Umfeld zu entfalten, das Innovation und Dynamik täglich lebt - Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir sind ein innovatives Tech-Startup in Berlin mit einem dynamischen Team, das die Grenzen von Technologie und Kreativität optimiert. Unsere Expertise umfasst unter anderem Bereiche wie RPA, KI und IPaaS. Wir sind mehr als nur ein weiteres Tech-Unternehmen; wir sind eine Bewegung, die zur Disruption inspiriert und Unternehmen dabei aktiv fördert und unterstützt, ihre Arbeitsweisen effektiv zu transformieren. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden entwickeln wir maßgeschneiderte Digitalisierungsstrategien und implementieren IT-Lösungen, die nicht nur den heutigen Anforderungen entsprechen, sondern auch die Arbeitswelt von morgen prägen. Bei deefinity steht alles im Zeichen der Innovation und des Erreichens außergewöhnlicher Erfolge.

Deine Aufgaben als Teil unseres Teams:


Entwicklung: Du entwirfst, entwickelst und implementierst IT-Lösungen zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit: Du arbeitest eng mit unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen zusammen, um die Anforderungen an die Automatisierung zu verstehen und effektive Lösungen zu entwickeln.
Qualitätssicherung: Du führst Tests durch, behebst Fehler und optimierst, um eine hohe Qualität und Effizienz sicherzustellen.
Prozessdokumentation: Du unterstützt dein Team, indem du an Prozessaufnahmegesprächen teilnimmst und diese dokumentierst.
Persönliche Entwicklung: Du wirst von erfahrenen Entwicklern lernen und konstruktives Feedback erhalten, um Dich weiterzuentwickeln.


Requirements

Das bringst du mit :


Sprachen: Mindestens gute Deutsch- (C1) und Englischkenntnisse (C1)
Ausbildung: Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulabschluss mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder ein vergleichbarer Abschluss
Engagement: Stark ausgeprägtes agiles Mindset, eigener Drive neues zu lernen
Erfahrung: Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit objektorientierten Programmiersprachen oder Automatisierungslösungen
Arbeitsweise: Verständnis für komplexe Prozesse und analytische sowie strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Einstellung: Teamgeist, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Spaß an projektbezogener Arbeit


Pluspunkte:


Idealerweise Kenntnisse in einer oder mehreren objektorientierter Programmiersprachen (z.B. C#, Python, Java...)
Erfahrungen mit Skriptsprachen (z.B. VBS, JS) sowie Build-/Deployment Tools (z.B. Azure)
Kenntnisse im Bereich Robotic Process Automation (UiPath, BluePrism, AutomationAnywhere, PowerAutomate, Robocorp)
Kenntnisse moderner Architekturkonzepte, Design Patterns und agiler Softwareentwicklung (Scrum, Kanban)


Benefits


Flex-work: Wir schätzen Deine Work-Life-Balance! Genieße unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitkonto), unser Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell mit 3 Tagen im Office und 2 Tagen Home-Office, und die Möglichkeit, Dir freie Tage zu gönnen.
Salary & More: Bei uns bekommst Du ein attraktives Gehaltspaket, das durch Benefits wie Bonuszahlungen, Jobticket für Deine tägliche Mobilität und eine Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft für Deine Fitness und Freizeit ergänzt wird.
Personal & Professional Development: Entwickle Dich kontinuierlich weiter - ob interne Coachings oder externe Weiterbildungen – Du bekommst ständig neue Chancen, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. Unsere Trainingspfade sind auf Deine Rolle und Deine persönlichen Interessen abgestimmt. Unsere Angebote umfassen Lunch & Learn Sessions, Work-Life-Balance Coachings, Soft Skill Trainings, positionsspezifische Workshops, Zertifizierungen und Mentoring Programme – alles perfekt auf Deine Rolle und Interessen abgestimmt.
Work-Life-Balance: Wir bieten Dir 30 Urlaubstage, Möglichkeiten für Workations, Sabbaticals und Teilzeitoptionen. Damit findest Du den perfekten Ausgleich zwischen Beruf und Freizeit.
Team Feeling: Bei uns steht das Miteinander im Vordergrund. Wir fördern eine vielfältige und inklusive Unternehmenskultur, feiern gemeinsame Erfolge, und stärken unser Teamgefühl durch regelmäßige Team-Events, Team-Meetings und Team-Lunches.
Empowering Company Culture: Arbeite in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen mit modernem Office im Herzen Berlins. Bei uns kannst Du Deine Ideen einbringen und umsetzen, dank flacher Hierarchien und schnellen Entscheidungswegen.
Broad Range of Projects: Tauche ein in eine Welt spannender, vielseitiger Projekte, die nicht nur Deine Verantwortungsbereiche erweitern, sondern auch sinnvoll und erfüllend sind. Bei uns findest Du Arbeit, die Sinn macht.
Fast Application Process: Erwarte einen schnellen Bewerbungsprozess mit umgehendem Feedback und regelmäßigen Status-Updates. Wir halten Dich auf dem Laufenden und schätzen Deine Zeit und Dein Engagement.
Warm Welcome & Structured Onboarding: Starte durch mit unserem strukturierten Onboarding-Prozess, inklusive Mentoring, Briefings und Welcome-Days. Wir sorgen dafür, dass Du Dich von Anfang an als Teil des Teams fühlst.

Title: Postdoctoral Scientist - AI/ML Bioimage Analysis
Description:
Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine R&D Data Science & Digital Health organization is recruiting for a Postdoctoral Scientist - AI/ML Bioimage Analysis (m/f/d) to join the Data Science Analytics & Insights team to help advance AI/ML Analytics for Drug Discovery.

The locations considered are Switzerland, Germany, Belgium, UK and USA, but exceptionally skilled candidates may be considered for remote work from anywhere in the world, with up to 10% travel.

This is a 2 year fixed term contract.

With $85.2 billion in consolidated sales for 2023, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 130,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.

The Data Science Analytics & Insights team develops innovative solutions using a variety of data sources across multiple different disease areas, encompassing oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, neuroscience, and infectious disease. We are looking for a highly motivated and innovative Postdoctoral Fellow who will work at the intersection of AI/ML, Computer Vision/Bioimaging, Multi-task Prediction and Molecule Design.

Key Responsibilities


Conceive, develop, and implement AI/ML solutions applied to drug discovery problems, including but not limited to, processing and analysis of large-scale imaging and assay data (e.g. high content imaging, cryogenic electron microscopy, tissue imaging, and medical imaging), molecule property predictions, and AI-based optimization
Contribute to design of analysis plan and technical execution of a project, and execute end-to-end analyses, including progress reports and high-quality code documentation
Work closely with a cross disciplinary team of data and AI scientists, imaging experts, biologists, and computational chemists, and leverages cross-domain expertise to contribute to a rigorous scientific evidence package strategically aligned with molecule development cycle
Extensive hands-on coding and actively contribute to platform development
Document and disseminate research findings internally and externally (e.g.- publishing in top-tier ML conferences/journals)
Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering /Biomedical Engineering/Computer Science/Applied Mathematics or related majors
Strong technical expertise in AI / deep learning with excellent analytical skills in at least one domain area with proven track records (publication in top-tier journals, awards, patents, white papers)
Extensive, hands-on experience in AI/ML in related applications such as High-dimensional biomedical imaging/ Computer Vision/ Omics Analysis/ AI-based Drug Design/ and other related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming language, preferably Python. Proficiency in one or more AI framework such as Pytorch or Tensorflow
Good communication skills an able to present analytical results on behalf of the project team in a cross-functional setting, contextualizing how it fits within the broader project


Benefits: Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. For additional general information on company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

At Johnson & Johnson, we're on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world's healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Show more
HTML:
Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine R&D Data Science & Digital Health organization is recruiting for a Postdoctoral Scientist - AI/ML Bioimage Analysis (m/f/d) to join the Data Science Analytics & Insights team to help advance AI/ML Analytics for Drug Discovery.

The locations considered are Switzerland, Germany, Belgium, UK and USA, but exceptionally skilled candidates may be considered for remote work from anywhere in the world, with up to 10% travel.

This is a 2 year fixed term contract.

With $85.2 billion in consolidated sales for 2023, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 130,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.

The Data Science Analytics & Insights team develops innovative solutions using a variety of data sources across multiple different disease areas, encompassing oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, neuroscience, and infectious disease. We are looking for a highly motivated and innovative Postdoctoral Fellow who will work at the intersection of AI/ML, Computer Vision/Bioimaging, Multi-task Prediction and Molecule Design.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceive, develop, and implement AI/ML solutions applied to drug discovery problems, including but not limited to, processing and analysis of large-scale imaging and assay data (e.g. high content imaging, cryogenic electron microscopy, tissue imaging, and medical imaging), molecule property predictions, and AI-based optimization
  • Contribute to design of analysis plan and technical execution of a project, and execute end-to-end analyses, including progress reports and high-quality code documentation
  • Work closely with a cross disciplinary team of data and AI scientists, imaging experts, biologists, and computational chemists, and leverages cross-domain expertise to contribute to a rigorous scientific evidence package strategically aligned with molecule development cycle
  • Extensive hands-on coding and actively contribute to platform development
  • Document and disseminate research findings internally and externally (e.g.- publishing in top-tier ML conferences/journals)
  • Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering /Biomedical Engineering/Computer Science/Applied Mathematics or related majors
  • Strong technical expertise in AI / deep learning with excellent analytical skills in at least one domain area with proven track records (publication in top-tier journals, awards, patents, white papers)
  • Extensive, hands-on experience in AI/ML in related applications such as High-dimensional biomedical imaging/ Computer Vision/ Omics Analysis/ AI-based Drug Design/ and other related field.
  • Proficiency with one or more programming language, preferably Python. Proficiency in one or more AI framework such as Pytorch or Tensorflow
  • Good communication skills an able to present analytical results on behalf of the project team in a cross-functional setting, contextualizing how it fits within the broader project

Benefits: Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. For additional general information on company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

At Johnson & Johnson, we're on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world's healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Explore a new world of possibilities:

At HomeToGo, we’re on a mission to make incredible accommodation easily accessible for everyone. Our team is united by a passion for travel, driven by innovation and impact, and guided by open-minded leaders at every level. Our commitment to recognizing and empowering exceptional talent is the foundation of our growth. We are actively hiring candidates from all around the world, including sponsoring visas for Germany. An amazing journey of opportunity with an international team lies ahead - join us!

Your future contribution:

Which destinations or categories of rental homes should we recommend to customers when they browse our website or receive our newsletter? How can we provide the most relevant list of results in our vacation rental search? How can we account for market trends, inventory quality and customer behavior to dynamically improve our products?

HomeToGo’s Data Science team is responsible for supercharging our products, particularly in areas such as search, recommendations, marketing, overall integration of NLP/LLMs functionality like Entity and Topic extraction, as well as supporting planning with forecasting. Leveraging our extensive demand, product, and supply data, we aim to deliver engagement and revenue-driving intelligence using sophisticated ML models. We are seeking to bolster our Data Science team to elevate these efforts to the next level and expand into new use cases.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will collaborate with our talented team of Data Scientists and partner with colleagues in various departments, including Search, Marketing, Analytics, and Engineering, to enhance and expand our AI-powered marketplace. This presents an exciting opportunity to join a team that significantly impacts HomeToGo's overall performance. You will tackle challenging problems and drive measurable business impact through our online A/B testing platform.

How you’ll add value:



Help in shaping our long-term Data Science strategy; from use cases to capabilities like Semantic Search or Search/e-mail personalisation, topic and entity extraction for our sourcing/product/customer service teams or building core abilities around imagery handling or forecasting
Design quantitative models and improve existing models by designing new features (offline and online) to drive customer engagement, booking conversions and other key metrics, e.g. revenue per user, booking in last X days for our ranking
Ensure proper selection of model offline quality metrics and maintain an adequate level of model explainability to support operation teams
Ensure efficient and cohesive workflows in our Data Science efforts to maximize business impact, while acting as a valuable sparring partner and facilitator for other Data Scientists
Serve as a consultative and creative partner for business and product stakeholders – understanding their needs and translating them into modeling problems



You’ll be successful in this role if you:



Have a proven track record as a Data Scientist in e-commerce or other modern digital services; Having experience in areas of Ranking, Recommender Systems or similar is a plus
Hold an MSc or PhD, with a strong academic record, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or another quantitative field
Have extensive hands-on experience in product analytics and A/B testing,, advanced modeling and ML, with a high comfort level using Python and SQL
Be able to blend into a technical environment using git, Docker, CI/CD and co.
Are familiar with modern large-scale data warehousing solutions (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery) and/or data processing engines (e.g. Spark, Presto) – ideally in the context of distributed cloud computing (e.g. AWS, GCP).
Have experience driving Data Science projects end to end, from the ideation to the proof-of-concept to the productionalization
Have the ability to thrive in a cross-functional setting: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize takeaways for non-technical partners, and a desire to influence business decisions
Bring intellectual curiosity, a desire for continuous learning, outcome orientation and a collaborative team-player attitude



Why HomeToGo?

Your journey with HomeToGo is a two way street - we’ve got you covered! We offer a diverse variety of benefits to enable your career development and make HomeToGo a great place to work, including:



The essentials: Competitive compensation package, visa sponsorship & relocation assistance*, full IT support & equipment, corporate benefits, modern offices, 27 paid vacation days a year (+ one additional day per year of employment until 32)
Career growth: 360° feedback, open feedback culture, buddy and mentorship programs from an international team of passionate industry experts
Personal development: German & Lithuanian language courses, internal and external workshops & trainings, company & team events, Gympass, clubs & sports (e.g. volleyball, running, yoga classes), psychological support
Startup spirit: Driven by our Leadership Principles: We are fast, nimble, and results-driven - embodying a startup mentality even as a global, public company. We encourage ownership and enable each other to succeed
Flexible work approach: Office-led and remote friendly approach; employees are offered remote work flexibility for up to 50% of the year, including work from abroad benefits. Plus, access to a Travel Industry Card
Climate action: Committed to being a pioneer in green travel: We’ve achieved an industry-leading “Low Risk” ESG Rating (16), awarded by Morningstar Sustainalytics, and are a proud member of Leaders for Climate Action
And so much more…
Certain conditions apply



About us:

HomeToGo is the SaaS-enabled marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.

Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, atraveo, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Kurzurlaub, Kurz Mal Weg, Tripping.com and Wimdu.

HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!
Show more

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of eye-tracking and computer vision technology, who are looking to expand their interdisciplinary research and development team.




The Role

This full-time position focuses on developing and integrating cutting-edge computer vision techniques to analyse large amounts of data. You'll collaborate closely with other teams to translate research into practical applications for their products.




Responsibilities

Evaluate and integrate advanced techniques into our analysis platform.
Design and build scalable pipelines to process large datasets.
Develop innovative solutions tailored to our specific needs.
Bridge the gap between research and real-world product development.

Qualifications

PhD in a relevant field (computer science, physics, etc.) or equivalent industry experience.
Strong understanding of SLAM and SfM methods.
Experience with NeRFs (a plus).
Proficiency in Python (C++ preferred).
Familiarity with relevant libraries (e.g., OrbSlam, COLMAP).
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills.

Benefits

Competitive salary and flexible work arrangements.
Collaborative and dynamic work environment with talented colleagues.
Opportunities for professional development (conferences, etc.).
Flexible work hours and support for publishing research.
Generous vacation time and healthy work-life balance.




Are you passionate about cutting-edge research and enjoy tackling complex problems? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and have a strong work ethic? If so, we encourage you to apply!

Show more

The Role

This full-time position focuses on developing and integrating cutting-edge computer vision techniques to analyse large amounts of data. You'll collaborate closely with other teams to translate research into practical applications for their products.


Responsibilities

  • Evaluate and integrate advanced techniques into our analysis platform.
  • Design and build scalable pipelines to process large datasets.
  • Develop innovative solutions tailored to our specific needs.
  • Bridge the gap between research and real-world product development.

  • PhD in a relevant field (computer science, physics, etc.) or equivalent industry experience.
  • Strong understanding of SLAM and SfM methods.
  • Experience with NeRFs (a plus).

  • Familiarity with relevant libraries (e.g., OrbSlam, COLMAP).

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and flexible work arrangements.
  • Collaborative and dynamic work environment with talented colleagues.
  • Opportunities for professional development (conferences, etc.).
  • Flexible work hours and support for publishing research.
  • Generous vacation time and healthy work-life balance.


Are you passionate about cutting-edge research and enjoy tackling complex problems? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and have a strong work ethic? If so, we encourage you to apply!

Title: MLOps / Artificial Intelligence Engineer (d/m/w)*
Description:
genua - Excellence in Digital Security

Möchtest du deine Leidenschaft für künstliche Intelligenz und MLOps in dem spannenden Feld der IT-Security einsetzen? Oder hast du bereits DevOps-Erfahrung und möchtest dich in Richtung KI weiterentwickeln? Dann werde Teil unseres neu formierten AI-Teams in Kirchheim bei München (85551), Berlin oder Leipzig und auf Wunsch gerne regelmäßig aus dem Home Office.

Was gibt es zu tun?


Deine Aufgabe ist die Bereitstellung und kontinuierliche Verbesserung von Trainings- und Inferenzinfrastrukturen für hochperformante und skalierbare KI-/ML-Lösungen, sowohl on Premise als auch in der Cloud. Dabei setzt du auf moderne Technologien wie Docker, Kubernetes und OpenShift
Du bewertest und optimierst Modelle, Datensätze und Software-Frameworks, um unter Einhaltung unseres hohen Qualitätsstandards Spitzenleistungen zu erzielen
Feile an neuen und bestehenden ML-Modellen und wähle die besten Algorithmen und Technologien aus
Du leistest einen wesentlichen Beitrag dazu, dass unsere IT-Security-Produkte noch intelligenter werden, und unsere Prozesse von KI-basierten Methoden profitieren
Du hast Lust auf den Kontakt zu deinen Mitmenschen und möchtest auch mal über den Tellerrand schauen? Super, denn ein Teil deines Arbeitsalltags kann es auch sein, verschiedene Unternehmensbereiche hinsichtlich des erfolgreichen und regelkonform Einsatzes von KI-/ML-Technologien zu beraten und zu unterstützen
Keine KI/ML-Technologien ohne Regeln - entwickle mit deinem Team Best Practices und Richtlinien für MLOps bei genua



Was bringst du idealerweise mit?


Umfangreiche Kenntnisse in Container-Technologien wie Docker und Orchestrierungsumgebungen wie Kubernetes oder OpenShift
Erfahrung mit der Bereitstellung und Überwachung produktionsreifer ML-Modelle (z.B. mit MLflow, Airflow, Prometheus, Grafana)
Berufserfahrung im Bereich MLOps, DevOps bzw. Data Science oder Data Engineering
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python oder einer vergleichbaren Programmiersprache
Erfahrung im Umgang mit verbreiteten Frameworks (z.B. Huggingface Transformer, PyTorch, Tensorflow, CUDA, scikit-learn) sowie Erfahrung in der Erstellung, dem Training und der Evaluierung von Machine-Learning-Modellen
Gängige Software-Entwicklungspraktiken und -Tools, inklusive Versionskontrolle, CI/CD und automatisierter Tests, sind für dich selbstverständlich
Fähigkeit, sowohl im Team als auch selbständig zu arbeiten, gepaart mit ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Lösungsorientiertes Handeln sowie starke Problemlösungsfähigkeiten für komplexe Herausforderungen
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mindestens ca. B2)



Bewirb dich bei uns - auch wenn du meinst, nicht alles erfüllen zu können, was hier steht. Gemeinsam entfalten wir nach und nach dein volles Potenzial!

Das bieten wir


Umfangreiche Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Kollegen, ein tolles Team und Wertschätzung auf allen Ebenen
Spannende Perspektiven in einem Unternehmen mit stabilem Kerngeschäft und großem Wachstumspotential
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zu mobilem Arbeiten
Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie durch eine betriebliche Kindertagesstätte und eine Kinderferienbetreuung sowie Unterstützung im Bereich Kindernotbetreuung
Ein Unternehmen, das die Hunde der Mitarbeiter willkommen heißt
Nachhaltige Mobilität ist dir wichtig? Uns auch! Wir erstatten deine ÖPNV-Fahrkarte, fördern E-Ladestationen bei dir zu Hause und bieten verschiedene Jobrad-Modelle
Individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und unser Karriereprogramm „career sprint“ als Eintritt in die Fach- bzw. Führungslaufbahn
Die Möglichkeit, von Experten zu lernen: Bei uns arbeiten Committer aus Projekten wie OpenStack, OpenBSD, OpenSSH, FreeBSD und Linux
Unsere GeekWeek: Hier können wir zweimal im Jahr, losgelöst vom Arbeitsalltag, Wissensdurst und Kreativität freien Lauf lassen und eigene Projekte verfolgen
Gemeinsame Firmenevents, vergünstigte Nutzung von Sport- und Gesundheitseinrichtungen und viele weitere Benefits
Betriebliche Altersversorgung



Wenn du dich angesprochen fühlst und die Möglichkeit ergreifen möchtest, in einem tollen Umfeld zu arbeiten und einen echten Unterschied zu machen, dann bewirb dich jetzt bei uns!

Und jetzt Du!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Jetzt Bewerben

Title: (Senior) AI Scientist (f/m/d) for the SAP BTP Innovation Team
Description:
We help the world run better

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

What You'll Do

At SAP, we are bringing together state-of-the-art AI technology with our extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities across SAP products & services. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, they are not the final stage of AI advancements and there is a lot of untapped potential to use data other than language to solve modern problems of business software. It is SAP's mission to overcome these challenges within the realm of Business AI.

As (Senior) AI Scientist, You Will


Develop innovative, scalable and high performing technical solutions by applying state-of-the-art technologies to SAP and customer problems.
Continuously research, implement and document emerging trends in AI/ML and evaluate their potential in an SAP context
Be a thought leader on how to best use SAPs knowledge and data together with latest AI advancements to gain a competitive advantage
The usual data science tasks such as data extraction, data cleaning, data exploration, feature engineering, and model building, with a focus on developing robust pipelines.
Drive AI workloads from idea to handover for production by defining and running experiments and integrating results into prototypes
Advance the data science and machine learning practices of our team to build better models faster.
Work closely with product management, designers, developers, and other data scientists to ensure project success


What You Bring


PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines
Deep understanding of the latest advancements in AI such as Transformer (and all its offsprings), Large Language Models, Large Multimodal Models, fine-tuning, RAG, Agents, etc.
Proficiency in Python, and experience with Data Science frameworks such as PyTorch, transformers, pandas, spark, etc.
Experience with cloud software development tools: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, AWS, BTP
Proven history of exemplary leadership and strategic mindset, complemented by superior organizational abilities.
Contributions to open-source projects or relevant private projects that demonstrate AI/ML skills are a plus
Start-up experience or background is a plus.


Meet The Team

The mission of the SAP BTP Innovation Team is to contextualize and pioneer emerging technologies that will be foundational for the future success of SAP BTP and of our customers. We are a diverse, global team and collaborate across roles, functions, and locations, enabling every colleague to contribute and investigate new ideas.

Our team in Potsdam explores new ways of working with technology to free up people’s creativity and ingenuity by reducing their repetitive tasks, brining contextual information at the right place and at the right time, and enabling time for the high value activities that have a real business impact. We work on articulating and prototyping visions of enterprise software beyond the current roadmaps, investigating the most important jobs-to-be-done in the enterprise, and run projects to take us closer to fully autonomous enterprise software. You can watch our vision behind the future of finance here. We currently drive a portfolio of projects that leverage state of the art AI and research and adapt it to be the best business AI in the world.

Bring out your best

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Requisition ID: 402707 | Work Area: Software-Design and Development | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Part-Time, or Regular Full-Time

HTML:
We help the world run better

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

What You'll Do

At SAP, we are bringing together state-of-the-art AI technology with our extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities across SAP products & services. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, they are not the final stage of AI advancements and there is a lot of untapped potential to use data other than language to solve modern problems of business software. It is SAP's mission to overcome these challenges within the realm of Business AI.

As (Senior) AI Scientist, You Will

  • Develop innovative, scalable and high performing technical solutions by applying state-of-the-art technologies to SAP and customer problems.
  • Continuously research, implement and document emerging trends in AI/ML and evaluate their potential in an SAP context
  • Be a thought leader on how to best use SAPs knowledge and data together with latest AI advancements to gain a competitive advantage
  • The usual data science tasks such as data extraction, data cleaning, data exploration, feature engineering, and model building, with a focus on developing robust pipelines.
  • Drive AI workloads from idea to handover for production by defining and running experiments and integrating results into prototypes
  • Advance the data science and machine learning practices of our team to build better models faster.
  • Work closely with product management, designers, developers, and other data scientists to ensure project success

What You Bring

  • PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines
  • Deep understanding of the latest advancements in AI such as Transformer (and all its offsprings), Large Language Models, Large Multimodal Models, fine-tuning, RAG, Agents, etc.

  • Experience with cloud software development tools: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, AWS, BTP

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist – Credit Risk & Risk Models (w/m/d)
Description:
Deine Modelle sorgen dafür, dass unser „risky business“ alles andere als das ist? Mit Deiner analytischen Denkweise, durchblickst Du komplexe Sachverhalte nicht nur, Du kannst sie auch verständlich erklären und bewerten? Dabei legst Du genau wie wir Wert auf ein wertschätzendes Miteinander und Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe? Perfekt! Bewirb Dich jetzt – Lebenslauf genügt – Dein Team im Centre of Expertise „Credit Risk“ freut sich schon auf Dich!

Deine Aufgaben


Mit Deiner Daten-Expertise entwickelst und verbessert Du unsere Risiko-Scorecards für Kreditentscheidungen und hilfst uns so, unser Risiko niedrig und den Mehrwert für unsere Kund*innen hoch zu halten.
Natürlich stellst Du außerdem sicher, dass unsere Kreditmodelle mit Konzernrichtlinien und -anforderungen im Einklang stehen – in der initialen Entwicklung und im Lauf ihres gesamten Lebenszyklus.
Deine Adleraugen wachen mittels Monitorings, Bewertung und Reporting sorgfältig über unsere Modelle und ihre Performance.
Dabei lenkst Du mit Gap-Analyse, Risiko Assessment und Mitigation alles in die richtigen Bahnen und dank Deiner detaillierten Dokumentation sind unsere Modelle stets zugänglich und verständlich.
Teamwork und Kommunikation schreibst Du groß und arbeitest so nicht nur eng und erfolgreich mit anderen Risikomodellfunktionen zusammen, sondern bist auch kompetente Ansprechperson für interne und externe Prüfer sowie Aufsichtsbehörden bei modellbezogenen Fragestellungen.


Dein Profil


Master-Abschluss in Statistik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Ingenieurwesen, Finanzen, Mathematik oder einem verwandten quantitativen Bereich; eine Promotion ist von Vorteil
Berufserfahrung in der Kreditrisikomodellierung / -validierung in Finanzinstituten
Praxis in Techniken des Machine Learning, etwa Regression, Klassifizierung, Clustering und Ensemble-Methodik, sowie Kenntnisse in Supervised und Unsupervised Learning und Erfahrung in der Lösung praktischer Probleme mit Machine Learning
Know-how in der Modellbildung (Datenbereinigung, Auswahl abhängiger Variablen, Untersuchung und Verständnis unabhängiger Variablen, Variablenreduktion, bivariate Analyse, Variablengruppierung, Erstellung logistischer / linearer Modellbildung, Modellvalidierung usw.)
Kenntnisse in Python und anderen analytischen Tools (SQL etc.)
Problemlösungs-, Motivations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, gepaart mit Zuverlässigkeit und einer Hands-on Arbeitsweise
Fließendes Englisch in Wort und Schrift, Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Freu Dich Auf Zahlreiche Benefits


Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, kostenloses Deutschlandticket & Bike LeasING, Betriebsrestaurant
Mobiles Arbeiten je nach Position und Abteilung im Rahmen von betrieblichen, regulatorischen und gesetzlichen Anforderungen, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle, Sabbatical, Bezuschussung von Pflege- & Kinderbetreuungskosten
Eigene Budgets für persönliche Entwicklung und Gesundheit plus persönliches Ausstattungsbudget für Deinen mobilen Arbeitsplatz


Bereit für einen neuen Job?

Bei der ING sind wir bunt und vielfältig: unterschiedliche Persönlichkeiten mit verschiedenen Perspektiven - in einer internationalen Kultur, in der wir uns wertschätzen. Dabei tragen wir Sneaker und Pumps, Hoodies und Anzüge. Weil Menschen nicht in Schubladen passen.

Das klingt ganz nach Dir?

Bewirb Dich jetzt einfach online bei uns – Dein Lebenslauf reicht uns, um Dich kennenzulernen, ein Anschreiben ist optional!
Show more
